CreateWallGeometry.description:
CreateWallGeometry(..)
  Creates a wall geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

AutoBreastAtlas.description:
AutoBreastAtlas(..)
  For auto breast planning only.
  Create aHEART, aRTLUNG, aLTLUNG from a structure template atlas, 
  unless they already exist.
  Parameters:
    PatientModelTemplate - Name of the atlas for lung and heart.
    Examination - Name of the examination.

CreateRoi.description:
CreateRoi(..)
  Create a new ROI.
  Parameters:
    Name - The name of the new ROI.
    Color - Display color of the ROI. Use a color such as 
      'Red' or an ARGB value such as '#FFFF0000'.
    Type - ROI type. Possible values;
      * External: External patient contour.
      * Ptv: Planning target volume (as defined in ICRU50).
      * Ctv: Clinical target volume (as defined in ICRU50).
      * Gtv: Gross tumor volume (as defined in ICRU50).
      * TreatedVolume: Treated volume (as defined in ICRU50).
      * IrradiatedVolume: Irradiated Volume (as defined in ICRU50).
      * Bolus: Patient bolus to be used for external beam therapy.
      * Avoidance: Region in which dose is to be minimized.
      * Organ: Patient organ.
      * Marker: Patient marker or marker on a localizer.
      * Registration: Registration ROI
      * Isocenter: Treatment isocenter to be used for external beam 
      therapy.
      * ContrastAgent: Volume into which a contrast agent has been 
      injected.
      * Cavity: Patient anatomical cavity.
      * BrachyChannel: Branchy therapy channel
      * BrachyAccessory: Brachy therapy accessory device.
      * BrachySourceApplicator: Brachy therapy source applicator.
      * BrachyChannelShield: Brachy therapy channel shield.
      * Support: External patient support device.
      * Fixation: External patient fixation or immobilisation device.
      * DoseRegion: ROI to be used as a dose reference.
      * Control: ROI to be used in control of dose optimization and 
      calculation.
      * FieldOfView: ROI to be used for representing the 
      Field-of-view in, e.g., a cone beam CT image.
      * AcquisitionIsocenter: Acquisition isocenter, the position 
      during acquisition.
      * InitialLaserIsocenter: Initial laser isocenter, the position 
      before acquisition.
      * InitialMatchIsocenter: Initial match isocenter, the position 
      after acquisition.
      * Undefined.
    TissueName - Name of the organ tissue. Optional.
    RbeCellTypeName - Name of the organ RBE cell type. Optional.
    RoiMaterial - Material that overrides ROI density. Optional.

CreateStructuresFromAtlas.description:
CreateStructuresFromAtlas(..)
  Create structures from template using atlas-based initialization.
  Parameters:
    SourceTemplateName - The source template name.
    SourceExaminationsNames - List of source (template) 
      examination names.
    SourceRoiNames - List of source (template) ROIs.
    SourcePoiNames - List of source (template) POIs.
    AssociateStructuresByName - Sets whether to associate 
      structures by name. 
      - If false, target structures with the same name as template 
      structures will be duplicated, 
        i.e., a new ROI or POI will be created and a suffix will be 
      added to the name.
      - If true, target structures that are empty will be populated. 
      Non-empty target structures will be disregarded.
      The default value is true.
    TargetExamination - The target examination.
    UseMultiAtlas - 
    RigidInitializationVoxelSize - Voxel size used for 
      initialization of atlases images in rigid registration step.

DetectBreastMarkers.description:
DetectBreastMarkers(..)
  For auto breast planning only.
  Detect the SUP, INF, MED, LAT and ANT markers, and create external 
  ROI.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The name of the examination.
    SUPName - Superior POI.
    INFName - Inferior POI.
    MEDName - Medial POI.
    LATName - Lateral POI.
    ANTName - Anterior POI.
    ExternalName - External ROI.

CreateMaterial.description:
CreateMaterial(..)
  Action for creating a new material based on another material. 
  Elemental atomic numbers, elemental masses, elemental weights and 
  mean excitation energy will be copied from the other material, 
  only density can be set.
  Parameters:
    BaseOnMaterial - The original material.
    Name - Name must be unique, not consist of more than 16 
      characters, not be empty and not only consist of whitespaces.
    MassDensityOverride - The density of the new material.

CreateHybridDeformableRegistrationGroup.description:
CreateHybridDeformableRegistrationGroup(..)
  Creates a deformable registration group with hybrid deformable 
  registrations for the selected reference examination and target 
  examinations.
  Parameters:
    RegistrationGroupName - A registration group with this 
      name is created.
    ReferenceExaminationName - The examination where the 
      deformation field is defined.
    TargetExaminationNames - The examinations the deformation 
      fields will point to.
    ControllingRoiNames - The list with ROI names for the 
      controlling ROIs.
    ControllingPoiNames - The list with POI names for the 
      controlling POIs.
    FocusRoiNames - The list with ROI names for the focus ROIs.
    AlgorithmSettings - The algorithm settings.
                  
      Properties:
                  
        * NumberOfResolutionLevels
          The number of resolution levels.
        * InitialResolution
          The deformation grid resolution (cm) at the initial 
      resolution level given in the DICOM patient-based coordinate 
      system. 
          Typical value (0.5, 0.5, 0.5).
        * FinalResolution
          The deformation grid resolution (cm) at the final 
      resolution level given in the DICOM patient-based coordinate 
      system. 
          Typical value (0.25, 0.25, 0.25).
        * InitialGaussianSmoothingSigma
          The Gaussian smoothing sigma at the initial resolution 
      level. Typical value 2.0.
        * FinalGaussianSmoothingSigma
          The Gaussian smoothing sigma at the final resolution 
      level. Typical value 0.333.
        * InitialGridRegularizationWeight
          The grid regularization weight at the initial resolution 
      level. Typical value 1500.0.
        * FinalGridRegularizationWeight
          The grid regularization weight at the final resolution 
      level. Typical value 400.0.
        * ControllingRoiWeight
          The controlling ROI weight. Typical value 0.5.
        * ControllingPoiWeight
          The controlling POI weight. Typical value 0.1.
        * MaxNumberOfIterationsPerResolutionLevel
          The maximum number of iterations per resolution level. 
      Typical value 1000.
        * ImageSimilarityMeasure
          The image similarity measure. Possible values: 
      "CorrelationCoefficient", "MutualInformation", 
      "MixedCorrelationMutual", "None".
        * DeformationStrategy. Possible values: "Default", 
      "InternalLung".
        * ConvergenceTolerance
          The tolerance for convergence. Typical value 1e-5.
      Example: 
                  
        AlgorithmSettings = 
        {
          'NumberOfResolutionLevels': 3,
          'InitialResolution': { 'x': 0.5, 'y': 0.5, 'z': 0.5 },
          'FinalResolution': { 'x': 0.25, 'y': 0.25, 'z': 0.25 },
          'InitialGaussianSmoothingSigma': 2.0,
          'FinalGaussianSmoothingSigma': 0.333,
          'InitialGridRegularizationWeight': 1500.0,
          'FinalGridRegularizationWeight': 400.0,
          'ControllingRoiWeight': 0.5,
          'ControllingPoiWeight': 0.1,
          'MaxNumberOfIterationsPerResolutionLevel': 1000, 
          'ImageSimilarityMeasure': "CorrelationCoefficient",
          'DeformationStrategy': "DeformationStrategy",
          'ConvergenceTolerance': 1e-5
        }

CreateControllingRoiGeometries.description:
CreateControllingRoiGeometries(..)
  Creates controlling ROI geometries for reference and target 
  examinations.
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExaminationName - The name of the examination for 
      which to create the controlling roi meshes.
    TargetExaminationNames - The names of the examinations on 
      which to create controlling roi geometries based on the meshes 
      created on the reference examination.
    RoiGeometryNames - The name of the roi geometry which the 
      controlling roi should adapt to.
    SmoothingRadius - Applies a morphological close and open 
      with a structuring element of the given radius 
      (in cm) before creating / adapting the triangle mesh. If set 
      to 0, no smoothing will be done
    DesiredTriangleEdgeLength - Desired edge length (in cm) 
      for the triangles in the mesh created on the reference 
      examination.
      Voxel size 0.1 x 0.1 x 0.1 will be used and a typical value 
      for DesiredTriangleEdgeLength is 0.3
    CreateNewRois - If true, the controlling roi meshes will 
      be placed in a new roi.
      If false, the controlling roi meshes will overwrite existing 
      roi geometries.

AdaptMbsMeshes.description:
AdaptMbsMeshes(..)
  Adapts MBS meshes to the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    RoiNames - The ROI names.
    CustomStatistics - Lookup table for custom image region 
      statistics per ROI.
    CustomSettings - Lookup table for custom settings per ROI.

CreateBiomechanicalDeformableRegistratio.description:
CreateBiomechanicalDeformableRegistrationGroup(..)
  Creates a deformable registration group with biomechanical 
  deformable registrations for the selected reference examination 
  and target examinations.
  Parameters:
    RegistrationGroupName - A registration group with this 
      name is created.
    ReferenceExaminationName - The examination where the 
      deformation field is defined.
    TargetExaminationNames - The examinations the deformation 
      fields will point to.
    ControllingRois - The list with controlling ROIs.
    DeformationGridVoxelSize - The deformation grid voxel size 
      in the DICOM patient-based coordinate system.

CreateStructuresFromTemplate.description:
CreateStructuresFromTemplate(..)
  Create structures from template.
  Parameters:
    SourceTemplateName - The source template name.
    SourceExaminationName - The name of the source (template) 
      examination.
    SourceRoiNames - List of source (template) ROIs.
    SourcePoiNames - List of source (template) POIs.
    AssociateStructuresByName - Sets whether to associate 
      structures by name. 
      - If false, target structures with the same name as template 
      structures will be duplicated, 
        i.e., a new ROI or POI will be created and a suffix will be 
      added to the name.
      - If true, target structures that are empty will be populated. 
      Non-empty target structures will be disregarded.
      The default value is true.
    TargetExamination - The target examination.
    InitializationOption - Initialization option. Possible 
      values;
      * EmptyGeometries
      * AlignImageCenters
      * RigidRegistration

CopyRoiGeometry.description:
CopyRoiGeometry(..)
  Copies an RoiGeometry from a source structure set to a target 
  structure set.
  Parameters:
    SourceExamination - The source examination.
    TargetExamination - The target examination.
    RoiName - The ROI name.

GetCenterOfRoi.description:
GetCenterOfRoi()
  Gets the ROI center of mass.
  Returns:
    The center-of-mass of the ROI in DICOM coordinates.

GetRoiVolume.description:
GetRoiVolume()
  Gets the ROI volume.
  Returns:
    Gets the ROI volume in cm^3.

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage(..)
  Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
  It is possible to select to get the region out in a format (image 
  size, voxel size) corresponding the examination it is defined on.
  As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
  where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
              
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing should be 
  given in mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    AsExamination - If true, the number of voxels, voxel size 
      and image corner will be the same as the examination the 
      roigeometry is defined on

GetBoundingBox.description:
GetBoundingBox()
  Gets the bounding box of the ROI geometry.
  Returns:
    The bounding box of the ROI geometry as an array of points 
    corresponding to min corner and max corner (in DICOM coordinates).

SetRepresentation.description:
SetRepresentation(..)
  Primary shape of the roi geometry will (if necessary) be changed 
  to the selected representation. Representation can be:
  - Contours
  - Voxels
  - Triangle mesh
  When changing the primary shape, a conversion between shapes is 
  done which can cause a small loss of data. 
  For more information on the conversion algorithms used and its 
  implications, please see RayStation Reference Manual chapter 
  Volume handling.
              
  Remark that a geometry cannot be converted to a MBS mesh using 
  this method. This can be done from the UI using the Create MBS 
  ROI(s) functionality, selecting "ROI based on contour ROI geometry"
  Parameters:
    Representation - Name of the Representation

DeleteGeometry.description:
DeleteGeometry()
  Deletes the geometry of a RoiGeometry.

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifie.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifiedGridSettings(..)
   Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
   Dimensions are given by parameters VoxelSize, Corner and 
  NumberOfVoxels. 
   Note that the grid settings need to be such that the bounding box 
  of the geometry is covered.
              
   As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
   where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
   
   Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing is given in 
  mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    VoxelSize - Voxel size in the exported image
    Corner - Corner for the exported image
    NumberOfVoxels - Number of voxels in the exported image

HasContours.description:
HasContours()
  Returns true if PrimaryShape has contours.
  Returns:
    True or False depending on if RoiGeometry.PrimaryShape 
    contains contours.

GetDependentRois.description:
GetDependentRois()
  Gets the name of all ROIs included in the derived ROI expression.
  Returns:
    List with ROI names

SetMarginExpression.description:
SetMarginExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI expression representing a margin 
  (expansion/contraction). Should be followed by 
  UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the geometry for a 
  specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

GrayLevelThreshold.description:
GrayLevelThreshold(..)
  Gray level thresholding.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    LowThreshold - The low threshold. The unit is in rescaled 
      pixel values, e.g. HU for CT. For PET images, PetUnit must be 
      specified.
    HighThreshold - The high threshold. The unit is in 
      rescaled pixel values, e.g., HU for CT. For PET images, 
      PetUnit must be specified.
    PetUnit - The unit for PET images. Common values:
      * Bq/ml (activity concentration)
      * g/ml (SUV)
    BoundingBox - The bounding box. If specified, only pixels 
      located inside the bounding box are thresholded, pixels 
      outside are ignored. If not specified the whole image set is 
      thresholded. The bounding box is defined by the minimum and 
      maximum corners, MinCorner and MaxCorner.
      Example:
         To consider the bounding box defined by the points (x_min, 
      y_min, z_min) and (x_max, y_max, z_max), set 
      BoundingBox={"MinCorner":{'x':x_min, 'y':y_min, 'z':z_min}, 
      'MaxCorner':{'x':x_max, 'y':y_max, 'z':z_max}}

CreateCylinderGeometry.description:
CreateCylinderGeometry(..)
  Create a cylinder geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the cylinder geometry.
    Axis - The axis (cm) of the cylinder geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Length - The length (cm) of the cylinder geometry along 
      Axis.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

AdaptMbsMesh.description:
AdaptMbsMesh(..)
  Adapts an MBS mesh to the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    CustomStatistics - Custom graylevel statistics.
    CustomSettings - Custom MBS settings.

SetAsExternal.description:
SetAsExternal()
  Sets this region of interest as the external ROI. If an external 
  ROI already exists, it will be replaced by this one.

CreateExternalGeometries.description:
CreateExternalGeometries(..)
  Creates external geometries for the ROI on the specified 
  examinations.
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExamination - The reference examination.
    AdditionalExaminationNames - The additional examination 
      names.
    ReferenceThresholdLevel - The threshold level that 
      determines the outline. Set to None in order to automatically 
      calculate threshold value.
      This threshold level is used for all additional examinations 
      of same modality.

CreateMarginGeometry.description:
CreateMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a margin geometry (expansion/contraction).
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

CreateControllingRoiGeometry.description:
CreateControllingRoiGeometry(..)
  Creates controlling ROI geometry for a ROI geometry on a target 
  examination using a controlling ROI geometry on a reference 
  examination
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExaminationName - The name of the examination on 
      which the controlling ROI has a geometry defined.
    TargetExaminationNames - The names of the examinations on 
      which to create a controlling ROI geometry.
    RoiGeometryName - The name of the ROI geometry which the 
      controlling ROI should adapt to.
    SmoothingRadius - Applies a morphological close and open 
      with a structuring element of the given radius 
      (in cm) before creating / adapting the triangle mesh. If set 
      to 0, no smoothing will be done.

SetRoiMaterial.description:
SetRoiMaterial(..)
  Assigns a new material to this ROI. The material density will 
  override the ROI density for dose computation on all image sets.
  Parameters:
    Material - The new material.

TransformROI3D.description:
TransformROI3D(..)
  Performs a 3D transformation of the ROI
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is 
      transformed
    TransformationMatrix - The transformation matrix
      Example:
        Move the geometry 1 cm in every direction
        TransformationMatrix = {'M11':1, 'M12':0, 'M13':0, 'M14':1,
                                'M21':0, 'M22':1, 'M23':0, 'M24':1,
                                'M31':0, 'M32':0, 'M33':1, 'M34':1,
                                'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1}
                  
      The scaling of the transformation matrix must be positive
      The last row of the transformation matrix must be the 
      following: 'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1

DeleteRoi.description:
DeleteRoi()
  Action for deleting an ROI.

VolumeThreshold.description:
VolumeThreshold(..)
  Threshold ROI geometry based on volume, i.e., keep components of 
  input ROI geometry having volume in interval [MinVolume, 
  MaxVolume] cm3.
  Typically used to clean up after a gray-level thresholding or 
  region-growing operation.
  Parameters:
    InputRoi - The input ROI.
    Examination - The examination.
    MinVolume - The minimum volume (cm3).
    MaxVolume - The maximum volume (cm3).

MultiSpectralThreshold.description:
MultiSpectralThreshold(..)
  Multispectral thresholding of examinations in a MR protocol 
  group. 
  For each examination, LowThreshold and HighThreshold should be 
  given. 
  The resulting segmented region will consist of points which are in 
  the given (examination specific) range for each examination.
  RoiGeometries will be created on each examination.
  Parameters:
    ExaminationNames - The examination names. All selected 
      examinations need to be in the same MR protocol group
    LowThresholds - The low thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations
    HighThresholds - The high thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations

CreateBoxGeometry.description:
CreateBoxGeometry(..)
  Create a box geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Size - The size (cm) of the box geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

CreateExternalGeometry.description:
CreateExternalGeometry(..)
  Creates an external geometry for the ROI on the specified 
  examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    ThresholdLevel - The threshold level that determines the 
      outline. Set to None in order to automatically calculate 
      threshold value.

SetAlgebraExpression.description:
SetAlgebraExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI algebra expression. The expression is defined 
  with two expressions, ExpressionA and ExpressionB, and the 
  combination of these. Should be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry 
  in order to create the geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

SetWallExpression.description:
SetWallExpression(..)
  Sets a derived expression representing a wall geometry. Should 
  be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the 
  geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

CreateSphereGeometry.description:
CreateSphereGeometry(..)
  Create a sphere geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the sphere geometry.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

UpdateDerivedGeometry.description:
UpdateDerivedGeometry(..)
  Updates the derived geometry for the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".

CreateFieldOfViewROI.description:
CreateFieldOfViewROI(..)
  Creates field-of-view ROI on a CBCT or CT image
  Parameters:
    ExaminationName - The name of the examination on which a 
      field-of-view ROI geometry will be created.

DeleteExpression.description:
DeleteExpression()
  Deletes the derived ROI expression.

CreateITV.description:
CreateITV(..)
  Creates an ITV ROI from the geometries of a source ROI in 
  several examinations. 
  The ITV geometry is the union of the geometries in the source ROI, 
  with margins applied as a final step.
  Parameters:
    SourceRegionOfInterest - The source ROI, which must have 
      geometry in all provided examinations.
    ExaminationNames - List of examinations by name. These 
      examinations must be in the same 4D examination group.
    MarginSettingsData - Margins applied to the union of the 
      geometries of the source ROI in the provided examinations.

CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry.description:
CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a beam specific margin ROI geometry by expansion in 
  distal, proximal and lateral directions relative either to the 
  chosen beam or to the chosen manual direction.
  - Note that there is no dependency between the resulting margin 
  ROI geometry and the source ROI geometry or the selected beam.
    If any of those are changed, the margin ROI geometry becomes 
  obsolete and must be regenerated.
  - Note that the margin distances are geometrical, not radiological.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source ROI.
    Beam - A beam defining the direction. Must be defined if 
      Direction is undefined.
    Direction - The direction in DICOM patient coordinates. 
      Must be defined if Beam is undefined.
    DistalDistance - The distal distance in cm.
    ProximalDistance - The proximal distance in cm.
    LateralDistance - The lateral distance in cm.

CreateAlgebraGeometry.description:
CreateAlgebraGeometry(..)
  Creates an algebra geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

CreateWallGeometry.description:
CreateWallGeometry(..)
  Creates a wall geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

CreateMarkerPois.description:
CreateMarkerPois(..)
  Identifies breast fiducials in a CT data set and creates the 
  corresponding marker POIs.
  Parameters:
    Names - The names of the marker POIs. Keys are: 
      "Superior", "Inferior", "Lateral" and "Medial". Values 
      defaults to: "Superior":"MED", "Inferior":"INF", 
      "Medial":"MED" and "Lateral":"LAT".
    Colors - The display colors of the marker POIs. Use named 
      colors such as 'Red' or an ARGB value such as '#FFFF0000'. 
      Keys are: "Superior", "Inferior", "Lateral" and "Medial". 
      Values defaults to: "Superior":"Purple", "Inferior":"Red", 
      "Medial":"Yellow" and "Lateral":"Blue".

CopyRoiGeometryToAnotherROI.description:
CopyRoiGeometryToAnotherROI(..)
  Copy the ROI geometry of an ROI to another ROI.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    FromROI - Name of the ROI with the geometry to copy.
    ToROI - Name of the ROI the geometry shall be copied to.

ImportSegmentationAsMetaImage.description:
ImportSegmentationAsMetaImage(..)
  Import segmentation as meta image file 
  (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
              
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing should be 
  given in mm.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    RoiNamesAndLabels - Dictionary containing wanted ROI names 
      and their corresponding labels in the meta image
    UseGreaterOrEqual - Default false. If true, ROI will be 
      equal to all voxels with values >= label

RoiSurfaceToSurfaceDistanceBasedOnDT.description:
RoiSurfaceToSurfaceDistanceBasedOnDT(..)
  Measures the distance between the surfaces of two ROI geometries 
  using a distance transform based approach. 
  Each point (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be 
  assigned the minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface 
  of the reference roi. 
  Note that the measurements are not symmetric
  A dictionary with average, max and min distances are returned
  Parameters:
    ReferenceRoiName - Name of roi from which surface to 
      compute the distance
    TargetRoiName - Name of roi to which surface to compute 
      the distance
  Returns:
    A dictionary with "Average", "Max", and "Min" distances

GetSuperiorInferiorRangeForExternalGeome.description:
GetSuperiorInferiorRangeForExternalGeometry()
  Gets the sup-inf range for the external geometry.
  Utility method for OutlineMbsMeshAction.
  Returns:
    A point with the range.

CreatePoisFromFiducialMarkers.description:
CreatePoisFromFiducialMarkers(..)
  Identifies fiducials in a CT data set and creates the 
  corresponding POIs.
  User can select to identify fiducials inside a ROI or inside the 
  patient outline.
  Parameters:
    PoiBaseName - The base name of the marker POIs. POIs will 
      be labelled POI_id
    DelimitingRoiName - Name of delimiting ROI. If left empty, 
      the External ROI will be used.
    LowDensityThreshold -

OutlineBodyOnCBCT.description:
OutlineBodyOnCBCT(..)
  Creates geometry for the External ROI for a limited 
  field-of-view CBCT examination.
  Parameters:
    ModelExaminationName - The name of the examination that 
      will be used as the model. Typically, the planning CT.
      The External ROI must have geometry defined for this 
      examination.
    ThresholdLevel - The threshold level used to guide an MBS 
      mesh based on the geometry of the External ROI for the 
      model examination. This value should be chosen such that 
      larger values correspond to 
      anatomy in the CBCT examination.
    FieldOfViewRoiName - The name of the field-of-view ROI 
      geometry. This ROI defines the region in which
      MBS adaptation is performed for the MBS mesh based on the 
      external geometry in the model
      examination.
    ExternalMbsRoiName - The name of the external MBS ROI.
    SupInfRange - The sup/inf range used when creating the 
      model (in cm).
      Should be given in CBCT coordinates.
      If (0,0) is given, the whole external on the model examination 
      will be used.

SetRoiGeometryRepresentationToTriangleMe.description:
SetRoiGeometryRepresentationToTriangleMesh(..)
  Set the ROI geometry to a triangle mesh.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    ROI - Name of the ROI that the triangle mesh shall be 
      assigned to.
    Indices - Array with triangle mesh indices.
    Vertices - Array with triangle mesh vertices.

ComparisonOfRoiGeometries.description:
ComparisonOfRoiGeometries(..)
   Computes overlap measures between two geometries for comparison.
   
   Dice similarity coefficient/index - DSC (also called Dice's 
  coefficient or Sorensen index): 
             2 | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA | + | ROIB |
   DSC range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   DSC with reference to:
   Dice, "Measures of the amount of ecologic association between 
  species", Ecology 26:297–302 (1945)
              
   Precision:
            | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA union ROIB |
   Precision range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   Precision with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Specificity:
            1 - | ROIB not ROIA | / | ROIA |
   Specificity is 1 for a complete overlap, and otherwise less than 1
   Delineation specificity with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Sensitivity:
            | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA |
   Sensitivity range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   Delineation sensitivity with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Mean distance to agreement (Mean DTA):
   Average distance for the surface of ROIA intersect ROIB to the 
  surface of ROIA union ROIB
   Measured using a distance transform based approach. Each point 
  (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be assigned the 
  minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface of the 
  reference roi. 
   Mean DTA is 0 for complete overlap. If no overlap, infinity is 
  assigned.
   Unit is cm.
   Note: If the Mean DTA has not been computed there will be no 
  corresponding entry in the return value.
              
   Max distance to agreement (Max DTA):
   Maximum distance for the surface of ROIA intersect ROIB to the 
  surface of ROIA union ROIB
   Measured using a distance transform based approach. Each point 
  (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be assigned the 
  minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface of the 
  reference roi. 
   Max DTA is 0 for complete overlap. If no overlap, infinity is 
  assigned.
   Unit is cm.
   Note: If the Max DTA has not been computed there will be no 
  corresponding entry in the return value.
  Parameters:
    RoiA - The name of the ROI geometry A.
    RoiB - The name of the ROI geometry B.
    ComputeDistanceToAgreementMeasures - Determines if Mean 
      DTA and Max DTA are computed (computation time will increase).
      If set to false, Mean DTA and Max DTA will not have 
      corresponding key/value entries in the return value.

SimplifyContours.description:
SimplifyContours(..)

    ReduceMaxNumberOfPointsInContours - Reduce the number of

GetCenterOfRoi.description:
GetCenterOfRoi()

    The center-of-mass of the ROI in DICOM coordinates.

GetRoiVolume.description:
GetRoiVolume()

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage(..)
  Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
  It is possible to select to get the region out in a format (image 
  size, voxel size) corresponding the examination it is defined on.
  As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
  where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
              
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing should be 
  given in mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    AsExamination - If true, the number of voxels, voxel size 
      and image corner will be the same as the examination the 
      roigeometry is defined on

GetBoundingBox.description:
GetBoundingBox()
  Gets the bounding box of the ROI geometry.
  Returns:
    The bounding box of the ROI geometry as an array of points 
    corresponding to min corner and max corner (in DICOM coordinates).

SetRepresentation.description:
SetRepresentation(..)
  Primary shape of the roi geometry will (if necessary) be changed 
  to the selected representation. Representation can be:
  - Contours
  - Voxels
  - Triangle mesh
  When changing the primary shape, a conversion between shapes is 
  done which can cause a small loss of data. 
  For more information on the conversion algorithms used and its 
  implications, please see RayStation Reference Manual chapter 
  Volume handling.
              
  Remark that a geometry cannot be converted to a MBS mesh using 
  this method. This can be done from the UI using the Create MBS 
  ROI(s) functionality, selecting "ROI based on contour ROI geometry"
  Parameters:
    Representation - Name of the Representation

DeleteGeometry.description:
DeleteGeometry()
  Deletes the geometry of a RoiGeometry.

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifie.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifiedGridSettings(..)
   Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
   Dimensions are given by parameters VoxelSize, Corner and 
  NumberOfVoxels. 
   Note that the grid settings need to be such that the bounding box 
  of the geometry is covered.
              
   As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
   where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
   
   Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing is given in 
  mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    VoxelSize - Voxel size in the exported image
    Corner - Corner for the exported image
    NumberOfVoxels - Number of voxels in the exported image

HasContours.description:
HasContours()
  Returns true if PrimaryShape has contours.
  Returns:
    True or False depending on if RoiGeometry.PrimaryShape 
    contains contours.

GetDependentRois.description:
GetDependentRois()
  Gets the name of all ROIs included in the derived ROI expression.
  Returns:
    List with ROI names

AdaptMeshToGeometryAndStoreAsNewRoi.description:
AdaptMeshToGeometryAndStoreAsNewRoi(..)
  Utility method for gold atlas data (part of gentle radiotherapy 
  project).
  A geometry which is a triangle mesh ("ModelGeometry") is adapted 
  to another geometry of any shape (RoiGeometry). 
  The adapted triangle mesh is stored as a geometry for a ROI which 
  is created by the method (NewRoi).
  Parameters:
    ModelGeometry - Name of RoiGeometry (which has 
      representation Triangle Mesh) to use as model
    RoiGeometry - Name of RoiGeometry to which the model 
      should be adapted
    NewRoi - Name of RoiGeometry where to store the adapted 
      triangle mesh

UpdateDerivedGeometries.description:
UpdateDerivedGeometries(..)
  Updates the derived geometry for the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    RoiNames - The ROIs to update.
    Examination - The target examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".
    AreEmptyDependenciesAllowed - If empty dependencies are 
      not allowed the resulting derived status will be set to 'Needs 
      update'
      if any of the geometries that an ROI depends on are empty.

Create4DCTProjection.description:
Create4DCTProjection(..)
  Creates a projection of a 4DCT using minimum-, maximum- or 
  average intensity projection.
  Parameters:
    ExaminationName - Name of the output examination.
    ExaminationGroupName - Name of the input examination group.
    ProjectionMethod - The projection method. Possible values:
      * MaximumIntensity
      * MinimumIntensity
      * AverageIntensity

ComputeRigidImageRegistration.description:
ComputeRigidImageRegistration(..)
  Computes a rigid image registration.
  Parameters:
    FloatingExaminationName - The name of the floating 
      examination which is rigidly transformed.
    ReferenceExaminationName - The name of the reference 
      examination which is not transformed.
    UseOnlyTranslations - Set to "true" if rotations shall be 
      discarded in the registration process.
    HighWeightOnBones - Set to "true" if the registration 
      algorithm shall focus on bony structures.
    InitializeImages - Set to "true" if the registration 
      algorithm shall try to find an approximate registration before 
      the accurate registration is computed.
    FocusRoisNames - Names of the focus ROIs.
    RegistrationName - Name of the registration. Only 
      applicable if an additional rigid registration is computed. In 
      case a frame-of-reference registration is created the name 
      will not be used and can be left empty.

LoadExamination.description:
LoadExamination(..)
  Sets the active/current examination. Returns a handle to the 
  examination.
  Example:
    To return a handle to the examination with name 'Exam X' 
    retrieved from QueryExaminationInfo:
    infos = db.QueryExaminationInfo(PatientInfo = patientInfo, 
    Filter = {'Name': 'Exam X'})
    examination = study.LoadExamination( ExaminationInfo = infos[0] )
  Parameters:
    ExaminationInfo - Information about the examination to be 
      selected. The examination info must match one and only one 
      examination.
  Returns:
    The loaded examination set.

DeleteDeformableRegistration.description:
DeleteDeformableRegistration(..)
  Deletes a deformable registration.
  Note: only deformable registrations with no dependent doses can be 
  deleted.
  Parameters:
    StructureRegistration - registration to be deleted

AddNewPlan.description:
AddNewPlan(..)
  Adds a new treatment plan.
  Parameters:
    PlanName - Name of the new plan.
    PlannedBy - Name of the planner.
    Comment - Comments of the new plan.
    ExaminationName - The name of the planning image set 
      defined for the new plan
    AllowDuplicateNames - Skip uniqueness test for name (used 
      by fallback plans).

ImportMetaImageToCurrentPatient.description:
ImportMetaImageToCurrentPatient(..)
  Reads data from a meta image file 
  (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation) 
  and creates a new examination with a corresponding image stack for 
  the current patient.
              
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Support for
  ObjectType              = Image
  NDims                   = 3
  BinaryData              = True
  BinaryDataByteOrderMSB  = False
  CompressedData          = False
  CenterOfRotation        = 0 0 0
  AnatomicalOrientation   = RAI
  ElementNumberOfChannels = 1
  ElementType             = MET_SHORT or MET_USHORT
              
  Patient position will be set to HFS
              
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing should be 
  given in mm.
  Parameters:
    FrameOfReference - Frame-of-reference. If empty, a new UID 
      will be generated.
    ExaminationName - Examination name
    MetaFileName - File name
    Modality - 
    FlipZAxis - Apply a flip of the z-axis

MapDose.description:
MapDose(..)
  Action for mapping dose from the target examination of the 
  registration to the reference examination of the registration.
  Note that it is possible to map a dose that has already been 
  mapped with the same registration.
  This will create two evaluation doses with the same properties.
  Parameters:
    FractionNumber - The fraction number of the dose 
      distribution.
      Default is zero.
    SetTotalDoseEstimateReference - Indicates if total dose 
      estimate reference should be set.
      Default is false.
    DoseDistribution - The dose distribution to map.
    StructureRegistration - The deformable registration to be 
      used for the dose mapping.
      The dose distribution must be defined on the target 
      examination of this registration.

CopyPlanToExploration.description:
CopyPlanToExploration(..)
  Creates a copy of the specified plan, converts it to an 
  exploration plan and appends it to the exploration plan list.
  Parameters:
    PlanName - Name of the plan to copy.
    NewExplorationPlanName - Desired name of the new 
      exploration plan.
    PlanExplorationName - Name of the exploration that shall 
      contain the copied plan.

ScriptableDicomExport.description:
ScriptableDicomExport(..)
  Exports specified DICOM datasets to either disk or SCP.
  Parameters:
    Anonymize - Anonymize all exported datasets
    AnonymizedName - Patients name to set in anonymized datasets
    AnonymizedId - Patient ID to set in anonymized datasets
    ExportFolderPath - Export target folder. Only used for 
      file exports. Leave empty for SCP export
    AEHostname - SCP AE name for SCP export. Leave empty for 
      file export
    AEPort - SCP Port for SCP export. Leave empty for file 
      export
    CallingAETitle - Calling AE title for SCP export. Leave 
      empty to use hostname
    CalledAETitle - Called AE title for SCP export
    Examinations - List of examination that shall be exported. 
      Specified by Examination names
      Argument snippet: Examinations = [examination.Name]
    RtStructureSetsForExaminations - List of examination names 
      for which the structure set shall be exported.
      Specified by examination names
      Argument snippet: RtStructureSetsForExaminations = 
      [examination.Name]
    RtStructureSetsReferencedFromBeamSets - List of beamset 
      identifiers for which the referenced structure set that shall 
      be exported
      The identifier shall be specified as PlanName:DicomPlanLabel 
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1" for plan "Plan 1" with beam set "BS 1")
      Argument snippet: RtStructureSetsReferencedFromBeamSets = 
      ["%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel)]
      Alternative snippet: RtStructureSetsReferencedFromBeamSets = 
      [beam_set.BeamSetIdentifier()]
    BeamSets - List of beamset identifiers that shall be 
      exported
      The identifier shall be specified as PlanName:DicomPlanLabel 
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1" for plan "Plan 1" with beam set "BS 1")
      Argument snippet: BeamSets = ["%s:%s"%(plan.Name, 
      beam_set.DicomPlanLabel)]
      Alternative snippet: BeamSets = [beam_set.BeamSetIdentifier()]
    BeamSetDoseForBeamSets - List of beamset identifiers for 
      which the beam set dose shall be exported 
      The identifier shall be specified as PlanName:DicomPlanLabel 
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1" for plan "Plan 1" with beam set "BS 1")
      Argument snippet: BeamSetDoseForBeamSets = 
      ["%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel)]
      Alternative snippet: BeamSetDoseForBeamSets = 
      [beam_set.BeamSetIdentifier()]
    BeamDosesForBeamSets - List of beamset identifiers for 
      which all beam doses shall be exported 
      The identifier shall be specified as PlanName:DicomPlanLabel 
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1" for plan "Plan 1" with beam set "BS 1")
      Argument snippet: BeamDosesForBeamSets = ["%s:%s"%(plan.Name, 
      beam_set.DicomPlanLabel)]
      Alternative snippet: BeamDosesForBeamSets = 
      [beam_set.BeamSetIdentifier()]
    SpatialRegistrationForExaminations - List of examination 
      pairs for which the registration object shall be exported.
      The pair is specified as fromExaminationName:toExaminationName
      Argument snippet: SpatialRegistrationForExaminations = 
      ["%s:%s"%(fromExamination.Name, toExamination.Name)]
    TreatmentBeamDrrImages - List of beamset identifiers for 
      which all treatment beam DRRs shall be exported 
      The identifier shall be specified as PlanName:DicomPlanLabel 
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1" for plan "Plan 1" with beam set "BS 1")
      Argument snippet: TreatmentBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel)]
      Alternative snippet: TreatmentBeamDrrImages = 
      [beam_set.BeamSetIdentifier()]
      If you want to specify a single beam or specific DrrSetting 
      other then Default, the identifier shall be specified as 
      PlanName:DicomPlanLabel:BeamName:DrrSettingName
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1:B 1:DRR 1" for plan "Plan 1", with beam set 
      "BS 1", and beam "B 1" and DrrSetting "DRR 1"
      The last two argument can be omitted if wanted. 
      Not specifying beam will take all beams in the beam set
      Not specifying DrrSetting will use the setting named "Default"
      Argument snippet: TreatmentBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, "", "")] # 
      all beams with Default DrrSetting
      Argument snippet: TreatmentBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, "", "DRR 
      1")] # all beams with DrrSetting named "DRR 1"
      Argument snippet: TreatmentBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, beam.Name, 
      "")] # only the selected beam with Default DrrSetting
      Argument snippet: TreatmentBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, beam.Name, 
      "DRR 1")] # only the selected beam with DrrSetting named "DRR 1"
    SetupBeamDrrImages - List of beamset identifiers for which 
      all setup beam DRRs shall be exported 
      The identifier shall be specified as PlanName:DicomPlanLabel 
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1" for plan "Plan 1" with beam set "BS 1")
      Argument snippet: SetupBeamDrrImages =  ["%s:%s"%(plan.Name, 
      beam_set.DicomPlanLabel)]
      Alternative snippet: SetupBeamDrrImages = 
      [beam_set.BeamSetIdentifier()]
      If you want to specify a single beam or specific DrrSetting 
      other then Default, the identifier shall be specified as 
      PlanName:DicomPlanLabel:BeamName:DrrSettingName
      (ex. "Plan 1:BS 1:B 1:DRR 1" for plan "Plan 1", with beam set 
      "BS 1", and beam "B 1" and DrrSetting "DRR 1"
      The last two argument can be omitted if wanted. 
      Not specifying beam will take all beams in the beam set
      Not specifying DrrSetting will use the setting named "Default"
      Argument snippet: SetupBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, "", "")] # 
      all beams with Default DrrSetting
      Argument snippet: SetupBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, "", "DRR 
      1")] # all beams with DrrSetting named "DRR 1"
      Argument snippet: SetupBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, beam.Name, 
      "")] # only the selected beam with Default DrrSetting
      Argument snippet: SetupBeamDrrImages =  
      ["%s:%s:%s:%s"%(plan.Name, beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, beam.Name, 
      "DRR 1")] # only the selected beam with DrrSetting named "DRR 1"
    DicomFilter - Dicom filter to use during export. Specified 
      by filter name.
    IgnorePreConditionWarnings - Switch for disabeling 
      warnings. For any clinical export, warnings must be handled by 
      first exporting with this argument set to False.
      Use a try - except pattern to catch all warnings. After the 
      warnings been handled, the export can bu run again with this 
      attribute
      set to True.
      Code snippet:
      try:
        case.ScriptableDicomExport(...)
      except SystemError as error:
        HandleWarnings(error)
        case.ScriptableDicomExport(... 
      IgnorePreConditionWarnings=True)

GetAccumulatedDeliveredDoseGrid.description:
GetAccumulatedDeliveredDoseGrid(..)
  Gets the dose grid for an accumulated delivered dose
  Can only be used for Patient.TreatmentDelivery.TreatmentCourse (an 
  exception is thrown if applied to TreatmentCourse under 
  TreatmentPlan)
  TreatmentFractions need to have 
  EstimatedDoseOnTotalDoseExamination calculated consecutivly 
  between FromFractionNumber and ToFractionNumber
              
  Experimental - use with care
  Parameters:
    FromFractionNumber - The fraction number you want to start 
      accumulating from (needs to be 1 or larger)
    ToFractionNumber - The fraction number you want to start 
      accumulating to
  Returns:
    DoseGrid for the accumulated delivered dose

GetBeamSetAtFractionForTreatmentDelivery.description:
GetBeamSetAtFractionForTreatmentDeliveryPlan(..)
  Gets the beamset used for a given fraction.
  Example:
    beamSet = 
    patient.TreatmentDelivery.GetBeamSetAtFractionForTreatmentDeliveryPlan(FractionNumber = nr)
  Parameters:
    FractionNumber - Fraction number, ranging from 1 to the 
      total number of fractions for the plan
  Returns:
    Returns beam set for selected fraction.

GetDoseAtRelativeVolumesForAccumulatedDe.description:
GetDoseAtRelativeVolumesForAccumulatedDeliveredDose(..)
  Method for retrieving DVH points for an accumulated delivered 
  dose.
  Parameters:
    FromFractionNumber - The fraction number you want to start 
      accumulating from (needs to be 1 or larger).
    ToFractionNumber - The fraction number you want to start 
      accumulating to.
    RoiName - The name of the ROI.
    RelativeVolumes - The relative volumes.

    dose.

GetPlanForDelivery.description:
GetPlanForDelivery()
  Gets the plan used for treatment delivery, i.e., the plan used 
  in treatment adaptation.
  Example:
    treatmentDeliveryPlan = 
    patient.TreatmentDelivery.GetPlanForDelivery()
  Returns:
    Returns treatment plan.

GetPlanningExaminationForTreatmentDelive.description:
GetPlanningExaminationForTreatmentDeliveryPlan()

  the plan used for treatment delivery, i.e., in treatment adaptation.

    patient.TreatmentDelivery.GetPlanningExaminationForTreatmentDeliveryPlan()

SetLastDeliveredFractionToPlannedAndSetF.description:
SetLastDeliveredFractionToPlannedAndSetFractionImageToUnprocessed()
  Sets the last delivered fraction to planned and set the fraction 
  image to unprocessed:
  - set fraction number to 0
  - set imaging system to None (if not automatically assigned at 
  import)
  - delete all created deformable registrations where the fraction 
  image is either reference or target image
  - delete all roi and poi geometries (except POIs of type 
  Acquisition isocenter, Initial laser isocenter and Initial match 
  isocenter)
  - delete rigid registrations (added rigid transform and treatment 
  position alignment registration). 
                Frame-of-reference registrations will not be deleted 
  if the fraction image is in the same frame-of-reference as another 
  image for the same patient
              
  Note!! 
  - All associated doses (fraction dose and mapped fraction dose) 
  will be deleted, as long as they are not referred to by other doses.
  - If the fraction image has been used as representatives for other 
  fractions, this action will affect also those.
  - If imaging system has been assigned at import, CBCT values to 
  density table will not be invalidated/removed.
  Example:
    patient.TreatmentDelivery.SetLastDeliveredFractionToPlannedAndSetFractionImageToUnprocessed()

SetLastDeliveredFractionToPlanned.description:
SetLastDeliveredFractionToPlanned()

  dose) will be deleted, as long as they are not referred to by 
  other doses.
  Example:
    patient.TreatmentDelivery.SetLastDeliveredFractionToPlanned()

GetDoseStatisticForAccumulatedDeliveredD.description:
GetDoseStatisticForAccumulatedDeliveredDose(..)

GetAccumulatedDeliveredDoseValues.description:
GetAccumulatedDeliveredDoseValues(..)
  Gets the dose values for an accumulated delivered dose
  Can only be used for Patient.TreatmentDelivery.TreatmentCourse (an 
  exception is thrown if applied to TreatmentCourse under 
  TreatmentPlan)
  TreatmentFractions need to have 
  EstimatedDoseOnTotalDoseExamination calculated consecutivly 
  between FromFractionNumber and ToFractionNumber
              
  Experimental - use with care
  Parameters:
    FromFractionNumber - The fraction number you want to start 
      accumulating from (needs to be 1 or larger)
    ToFractionNumber - The fraction number you want to start

AddClinicalGoal.description:
AddClinicalGoal(..)
  Adds a clinical goal to an evaluation setup
  Parameters:
    RoiName - The name of the ROI or POI the planning goal 
      shall be evaluated on.
    GoalCriteria - The planning goal criteria. Specifies the 
      region for pass and fail.
      * AtLeast: At least criteria.
      * AtMost: At most criteria.
    GoalType - The planning goal type. 
      * AverageDose: For comparison with the average dose.
      * VolumeAtDose: For comparison of the volume at a specified 
      dose.
      * DoseAtVolume: For comparison of the dose at a specified 
      volume.
      * DoseAtPoint: For comparison with the dose at a certain point.
      * AbsoluteVolumeAtDose: For comparison of the absolute volume 
      at a specified dose.
      * DoseAtAbsoluteVolume: For comparison of the dose at a 
      specified absolute volume.
    AcceptanceLevel - The acceptance level. Sets the level for 
      pass or fail.
    ParameterValue - The parameter value. Goal type specific 
      parameter.
    IsComparativeGoal - Determines if the goal is used as a 
      comparative goal.
    Priority - The priority of the clinical goal.

ComputeDeliveryDoseWithDeformation.description:
ComputeDeliveryDoseWithDeformation(..)
  Action used to compute delivery dose and do optional deformation 
  of that dose
  Parameters:
    FractionNumbers - The numbers of the fractions for which 
      the dose is to be computed. This is a required property
      and the number of items in this list must equal the number of 
      items in the ExaminationNames and
      StructureRegistrationNames properties. This property must 
      contain at least one item.
    ExaminationNames - The names of the examinations to be 
      used. This is a required property and the number of items
      in this list must equal the number of items in the 
      FractionNumbers and StructureRegistrationNames
      properties.
    StructureRegistrationNames - The names of the provided 
      structure registrations. If an item in the list is empty, the 
      dose will
      not be deformed. The number of items in this list must equal 
      the number of items in the
      FractionNumbers and ExaminationNames properties.

SetWeightedDose.description:
SetWeightedDose(..)
  Sets the dose to a weighted sum of the 
  fraction doses of the beam sets for a number of plans.
  If the dose distribution is a fraction dose, the plan dose is 
  updated accordingly.
  An exception is thrown if the dose distribution is a composite 
  dose, if the PlanNames array 
  is longer than the Weights array, if the PlanNames array contains 
  a name that does not 
  match any plan name for the current patient, if any of the plans 
  in the PlanNames array 
  contains no beam set or more than one beam set or if any of the 
  plans in the PlanNames array 
  does not have a computed fraction dose.
  Parameters:
    PlanNames - A list of the names of the plans whose 
      fraction doses will be used for the dose sum.
    Weights - A list of the weights of the fraction doses.

LoadPlan(..)
  Loads a plan from a patient. Returns a handle to the plan.
  Example:
    To return a handle to the first plan in a list retrieved 
    from QueryPlanInfo:
    plans = patient.QueryPlanInfo(PlanInfo = {'Name': 'Plan1'} )

ImportDeformableRegistrationFromFile.description:
ImportDeformableRegistrationFromFile(..)
  Action for reading a deformable registration from file.
  Displacement in x, y, and z should be stored as byte arrays
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExaminationName - Gets or sets the name of the 
      reference examination.
    TargetExaminationName - Gets or sets the name of the 
      target examination.
    DeformableRegistrationGroupName - Gets or sets the name of 
      the deformable registration group that will be created.
    AddedRigidTransform - Gets or sets the rigid transform for 
      the deformable registration.
      If null, the identity matrix will be used.
      Note that in RayStation only one additional rigid transform 
      can be added between each pair of image set. 
      This means that if you have already created an additional 
      rigid transform, the same matrix should be given as 
      AddedRigidTransform
      Furthermore, rigid transforms (if different than identity) can 
      only be added to explicit frame-of-reference registrations
    FrameOfReferenceRigidTransform - Gets or sets the rigid 
      transform for the frame-of-reference registration.
      If a frame-of-reference registration already exist between the 
      reference and target examination, 
      FrameOfReferenceRigidTransform should be null
    GridCorner - Gets or sets the deformation grid corner.
      Note that deformation vectors are defined in the corner points 
      of each deformation grid voxels. Hence, GridCorner should 
      correspond to position of the first deformation vector in your 
      deformation vector field
    GridVoxelSize - Gets or sets the deformation grid voxel 
      size.
    GridNrVoxels - Gets or sets the deformation grid size.
      Note that deformation vectors are defined in the corner points 
      of each deformation grid voxels. Hence, GridNrVoxels should be 
      decreased with one in each direction with respect to the 
      number of vectors
    FileNameDisplacementX - Gets or sets the file name for 
      displacement field in x.
    FileNameDisplacementY - Gets or sets the file name for 
      displacement field in y.
    FileNameDisplacementZ - Gets or sets the file name for 
      displacement field in z.

TransformPointFromExaminationToExaminati.description:
TransformPointFromExaminationToExamination(..)
  Transforms a point (in DICOM patient coordinate system) from 
  FromExamination to ToExamination.

    Point - Point to transform (in DICOM patient coordinate 
      system).
  Returns:
    Transformed point (in DICOM patient coordinate system). 
    Returns null if no transform exists.

AddNewAdaptivePlan.description:
AddNewAdaptivePlan(..)
  Action for creating a new adapted plan.
              
  Prerequisite: deformable image registration (DIR) with new 
  planning image as reference image and original planning image as 
  target image. 
  The DIR should be approved for dose accumulation.
              
  Example:
  # add new adapted plan from fraction 10 to a plan with one beam 
  set using planning image "RESCAN"
  patient = get_current("Patient")
  case = get_current("Case")
  plan=get_current("Plan")
  beam_set=get_current("BeamSet")
  adapt_from_fx = 10
  adapted_ct = "RESCAN"
  tot_nr_fx = len([tf for tf in 
  plan.TreatmentCourse.TreatmentFractions])
              
  adapted_plan = case.AddNewAdaptivePlan(FractionNumber= 
  adapt_from_fx, AdaptToPlanName= plan.Name, 
  UseTreatmentDeliveryAsSource= True,
  PlanName= "Adapted plan", PlannedBy= None, Comment= "", 
  ExaminationName= adapted_ct, AllowDuplicateNames= False)
  treatment_technique = beam_set.GetTreatmentTechniqueType()
              
  beam_set_settings = {'NumberOfRemainingFractions': tot_nr_fx - 
  adapt_from_fx, 'MachineName': 
  beam_set.MachineReference.MachineName, 
  'CreateSetupBeams': true, 'DicomPlanLabelOfOriginalBeamSet': 
  beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, 'ClearBeamModifiers': false, 
  'RemoveBeams': false, 'TreatmentTechnique': treatment_technique}
  adapted_plan.AddBeamSetsToAdaptedPlan(AdaptedBeamSets=[beam_set_settings])
  
  adapted_beam_set = adapted_plan.BeamSets[0]
  prescription = beam_set.Prescription.PrimaryDosePrescription
  adapted_beam_set.AddDosePrescriptionToRoi(
  RoiName=prescription.OnStructure.Name,
  DoseVolume=prescription.DoseVolume,
  PrescriptionType=prescription.PrescriptionType,
  DoseValue=prescription.DoseValue,
  RelativePrescriptionLevel=prescription.RelativePrescriptionLevel,
  AutoScaleDose=False)
  Parameters:
    FractionNumber - Fraction for which to start the delivery 
      of the adapted plan. 
      FractionNumber has to be less or equal to the number of 
      fractions for the original plan + 1.
      If 'UseTreatmentDeliveryAsSource', FractionNumber needs to be 
      larger than the number of delivered fractions
    AdaptToPlanName - Name of the plan for which adaptation 
      should be done
    UseTreatmentDeliveryAsSource - Sets if background dose 
      during optimization should be 
      - delivered accumulated dose (as computed in DoseTracking 
      workspace and store as TreatmentCourse under 
      TreatmentDelivery) [TRUE], or
      - planned accumulated dose [FALSE]
    PlanName - Name of the new plan.
    PlannedBy - Name of the planner.
    Comment - Comments of the new plan.
    ExaminationName - The name of the planning image set 
      defined for the new plan
    AllowDuplicateNames - Skip uniqueness test for name (used 
      by fallback plans).

CopyMultipleExplorationPlansToPlanList.description:
CopyMultipleExplorationPlansToPlanList(..)

AssignToNewFrameOfReference.description:
AssignToNewFrameOfReference()
  Method for assigning a new frame-of-reference to the examination. 
              
  Stored dicom data will be updated with the new Frame of Reference 
  UID (0020, 0052), new SOP Instance UIDs (0008, 0018) and a new 
  Series Instance UIDs (0020, 000E). 
  The modified tags will be used if the examination is exported.
              
  Note that if the method is used on an examination which is in the 
  same frame-of-reference as another examination or is in the same 
  frame-of-reference as the to or from frame-of-reference in a 
  FrameOfReferenceRegistration, 
  methods demanding that examinations are in the same 
  frame-of-reference (or has a frame-of-reference registration 
  defined), such as create deformable registraion or compute dose on 
  additional set,
  can not be used until a new frame-of-reference registration 
  between the examinations has been created.
  Can only be used if the examination:
  - has not been used to create a frame-of-reference registration
  - is not referenced in a structure registration (i.e., added rigid 
  transform or deformable registration), 
  - is not part of an examination group,
  - is not referenced by a treatment plan, or
  - does not have computed doses
              
  Patient will be closed and reopened in order to initalize views 
  correctly given the new frame-of-reference

SetImagingSystemReference.description:
SetImagingSystemReference(..)
  Action that sets ImagingSystemReference for the EquipmentInfo of 
  an Examination. 
  If the examination belongs to an 4DCT group, all examinations in 
  the group will be assigned the selected ImagingSystem.
  Only commissioned, nondepricated ImagingSystems can be used.
  If the selected ImagingSystem is a CBCT machine, Modality will be 
  updated to 'CBCT'.
  Parameters:
    ImagingSystemName - The name of the ImagingSystem
      Note: if left empty ImagingSystem will be assigned 'None'. If 
      changing from a CBCT machine, Modality will be updated to 'CT'

SetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage.description:
SetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage(..)
  Action that sets CtToDensityTable for a CBCT image. In parameter 
  is an array with five short ints that correspond to the density 
  thresholds between:
    Air to Lung
    Lung to Adipose
    Adipose to Tissue
    Tissue to Cartilage/Bone
    Cartilage/Bone to Other
  Values within the threshold ranges will be mapped to the following 
  densities:
    Materials.Air             0.00121
    Materials.Lung            0.26
    Materials.Adipose         0.95
    Materials.Tissue          1.05
    Materials.CartilageBone   1.6
    Materials.Other           3.0
  Parameters:
    DensityThresholds -  Density thresholds (in CBCT values) 
      used to create the CT to density table

CopyCtToDensityTableFromAnotherCbctImage.description:
CopyCtToDensityTableFromAnotherCbctImage(..)
  Reuses the CT to density table from another CBCT image. 
  Typically this is done in the dose tracking use case. The CT to 
  density table is created for the first fraction image and then 
  used for all other fraction images.
  Parameters:
    FromExaminationName -  Name of the examination from which 
      to copy the CT to density table

SetImageSpecificCtToDensityTable(..)

    Rho - Array with mass density values [in g/cm^3]

ExportExaminationAsMetaImage.description:
ExportExaminationAsMetaImage(..)
  Export examination as a meta image file 
  (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
              
  ObjectType              = Image
  NDims                   = 3
  BinaryData              = True
  BinaryDataByteOrderMSB  = False
  CompressedData          = False
  Offset                  = corner center in x, corner center in y, 
  corner center in z
  ElementSpacing          = voxel size in x, voxel size in y, voxel 
  size in z
  DimSize                 = number of voxels in x, number of voxels 
  in y, number of voxels in z
  ElementNumberOfChannels = 1
  ElementType             = MET_SHORT
  ElementDataFile         = MetaFileName
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence Offset and 
  ElementSpacing will be exported in mm.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name

CropImageStackAndStoreAsNewExamination(..)

  The cropped image stack is stored as a new examination, in the 
  same frame-of-reference and with the same voxel size as the 
  original.

    MaxCorner - Max corner of bounding box
  Returns:

GetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage.description:
GetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage()
  Computes automatically the thresholds needed for creating a CT 
  to density table for CBCT and creates the corresponding CT to 
  density table. 
  The CT to density table will be the same as when the 'auto' option 
  is used in the "Create Density Table for CBCT" dialog.
  Example:
    [huArray, rhoArray] = cbct.GetCtToDensityTableForCbctImage()
