    HU values [Hounsfield units] and the second array the densities 
    [g/cm^3].

GetAcquisitionDataFromDicom.description:
GetAcquisitionDataFromDicom()
  Gets acquisition related DICOM tags for the given examination.
  The return value is a dictionary consisting of four modules:
    'EquipmentModule'
    'StudyModule'
    'SeriesModule'
    'ImageModule'
              
  Example:
    data = examination.GetAcquisitionDataFromDicom()
    data['EquipmentModule']['Manufacturer']           // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,0070)
    data['EquipmentModule']['InstitutionName']        // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,0080)
    data['EquipmentModule']['DeviceSerialNumber']     // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0018,1000)
    data['EquipmentModule']['StationName']            // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,1010)
    data['EquipmentModule']['ManufacturersModelName'] // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,1090)
              
    data['StudyModule']['StudyDescription']           // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0008,1030)
    data['StudyModule']['StudyInstanceUID']           // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0020,000D)
    data['StudyModule']['StudyID']                    // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0020,0010)
    data['StudyModule']['StudyDateTime']              // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0020) and (0008,0030)
    data['StudyModule']['AccessionNumber']            // Type: Int, 
  DICOM tag: (0008,0050)
                                                      
    data['SeriesModule']['SeriesDescription']         // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag:(0008,103E)
    data['SeriesModule']['SeriesInstanceUID']         // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag:(0020,000E)
    data['SeriesModule']['ProtocolName']              // Type: 
  String, DICOM tag: (0018,1030)
    data['SeriesModule']['SeriesDateTime']            // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0021) and (0008,0031)
                                                      
    data['ImageModule']['AcquisitionNumber']          // Type: Int, 
  DICOM tag: (0020,0012)
    data['ImageModule']['AcquisitionDateTime']        // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0022) and (0008,0032) (note that the 
  earliest time among the slices is returned)
    data['ImageModule']['ContentDateTime']            // Type: 
  DateTime, DICOM tag: (0008,0023) and (0008,0033) (note that the 
  earliest time among the slices is returned)

SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistratio.description:
SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(..)
  Action that sets treatment position alignment registration for a 
  CBCT image to the planning image for the treatment delivery plan.
  The CBCT image will be aligned with respect to the beam isocenter 
  of the beams for the current fraction. 
  Treatment adaptation has to be initialized.
              
  Example 1, Manually entered isocenter, Setup correction included 
  in CBCT isocenter:
  case.Examinations['CBCT 
  4'].SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(ManualTPAlignment=True, SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter=True, IsocenterReference="Intrinsic", IntrinsicIsocenter={ 'x': -22.44, 'y': -22.44, 'z': -0.17 }, TreatmentPlanForDelivery=plan) 
  
              
  Example 2, Isocenter from treatment plan, Manually entered couch 
  setup:
  case.Examinations['CBCT 
  4'].SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(ManualTPAlignment=True, SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter=False, CouchRotationAngle=358, CouchRotationAxis={ 'x': 0, 'y': -1, 'z': 0 }, CouchTranslation={ 'x': 1, 'y': -1.5, 'z': 0.5 }, IsocenterReference="RtPlan", TreatmentPlanForDelivery=plan)
  
              
  Example 3, Varian OBI imaging system with marker match POIs:
  case.Examinations['CBCT 
  4'].SetTreatmentPositionAlignmentRegistration(ManualTPAlignment=False, SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter=False, CouchRotationAngle=0, CouchRotationAxis={ 'x': 0, 'y': -1, 'z': 0 }, CouchTranslation={ 'x': 0.15, 'y': 0.16, 'z': -0.16 }, IsocenterReference="Intrinsic", IntrinsicIsocenter={ 'x': -23.42, 'y': -24.21, 'z': 0.1 }, TreatmentPlanForDelivery=plan)
  
  Intrisic isocenter is the position of the Aquisition isocenter POI 
  on the CBCT.
  The couch translation is calculated as the Aquisition isocenter 
  POI - Initial match isocenter POI on the CBCT.
  Parameters:
    ManualTPAlignment - Defines if the treatment position 
      alignment information is given manually. (In opposite to if 
      marker match POIs is used, supported only by Varian OBI)
    SetupCorrectionIncludedInCbctIsocenter - Defines if setup 
      correction is included in cbct isocenter information or not. 
      If not, couch rotation angle, couch rotation axis and couch 
      translation need to be defined.
      Otherwise, those parameters should be set to null
    CouchRotationAngle - Setup correction: couch rotation 
      angle [deg]
    CouchRotationAxis - Setup correction: couch rotation axis 
      (in DICOM coordinates). Needs to be of length one. 
      Default from UI is rotation around Post-Ant direction, i.e., 
      {'x': 0, 'y': -1, 'z': 0} when used from scripting (dicom 
      coordinates)
    CouchTranslation - Setup correction: couch translation [cm].
    IsocenterReference - How the coordinate system of the CBCT 
      image is defined. Possible values:
      'Intrinsic'  : Coordinate system for which the isocenter point 
      used during patient setup has the coordinates of the 
      IntrinsicIsocenter
      'RtPlan'     : Coordinate system for which the isocenter point 
      used during patient setup has the coordinates as in the 
      corresponding plan, i.e., the image is pre-aligned with the 
      frame-of-reference used in the plan
    IntrinsicIsocenter - Coordinate corresponding to the 
      isocenter of the CBCT image [cm]
      Required if 'IsocenterReference' is 'Intrinsic'. 
      In case 'IsocenterReference' is 'RtPlan', 'IntrinsicIsocenter' 
      will be set to the (shared) beam isocenter for the radiation 
      set used for the current fraction.
    TreatmentPlanForDelivery - Plan used for treatment delivery

CreateTransformedExamination.description:
CreateTransformedExamination(..)
  Method for creating a rigidly transformed examination from an 
  existing.
              
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    ExaminationName - Name given to the transformed examination
    YawRotation - Rotation angle in yaw direction (around 
      ant-post)
    PitchRotation - Rotation angle in pitch direction (around 
      left-right)
    RollRotation - Rotation angle in roll direction (around 
      sup-inf)
    Translation - Translation (in patient coordinate system: 
      r-l, i-s, p-a)
    FrameOfReference - Frame-of-reference for the transformed 
      examination. If empty string is given the Frame-Of-Reference 
      will be set to the same as for the original examination
  Returns:

WriteStoredDicomDataSetToFileForVerifica.description:
WriteStoredDicomDataSetToFileForVerification(..)
  Write the stored dicom data for the current examination to a 
  text file.
              
  One image slice is used to collect the requested information.
  Hence, for tags with different values in different slices (SOP 
  Instance UID, Content time, Image Position etc), only one value 
  will be reported.
              
  One level of dicom sequence tags is handled. This means that, 
  e.g., for PET images not all the stored tags are exported.
  Parameters:
    FileName - Name of the file

GetDensityThresholdsForCbctImage.description:
GetDensityThresholdsForCbctImage()
  Computes automatically the thresholds needed for creating a CT 
  to density table for CBCT using the 'auto' option. 
  The thresholds will be the same as when the 'auto' option is used 
  in the "Create Density Table for CBCT" dialog. 
  The thresholds can be used as in parameter to 
  SetCtToDensityTableForCbctImageAction.
  Example:
    densityThresholds = cbct.GetDensityThresholdsForCbctImage()
  Returns:
    Returns a dictionary with threshold names and corresponding 
    CBCT values.

GetStoredDicomTagValueForVerification.description:
GetStoredDicomTagValueForVerification(..)
  Get the stored dicom tag value for verification. Tag is given as 
  group and element in hexadecimal format, 
  i.e., Group=0x0008, Element=0x0008 will give back attribute "Image 
  Type"
              
  Dicom sequence tags are currently not supported.
              
  One image slice is used to collect the requested information.
  Hence, for tags with different values in different slices (SOP 
  Instance UID, Content time, Image Position etc), only one value 
  will be reported.
  Parameters:
    Group - Group (hexadecimal)
    Element - Element (hexadecimal)
  Returns:
    Dictionary with description and value (as a string)

GetPixelValues()

GetResampledPETValues(..)

GetImageStackHistogram.description:
GetImageStackHistogram(..)
  Computes an histogram over image intensities, either over the 
  whole image or inside an ROI.
  Note that the ROI relative volumes are not accounted for.
  Parameters:
    BinSize - Size of the bins. If BinSize is set to zero, 
      will generate a histogram with around 300 bins.
    ExcludePixelPadding - If true, pixel padding voxel will be 
      excluded from the histogram
    RoiName - Name of ROI which to compute the histogram 
      inside. If left empty, the whole image will be used
    ConvertCbctValueToHu - For CBCT image, apply CBCT values 
      to HU transformation before computing histogram. Note that a 
      CBCT values to density table needs to be specified.
  Returns:
    A sorted dictionary with bin id (i.e., a short) and its nr 
    of entries

GetIntensityStatistics.description:
GetIntensityStatistics(..)
  Computes statistics for the intensities inside an ROI. The 
  result is returned as a dictionary with statistics type 
  ("Average", "Min", "Max") value and unit.
              
  From python script the values are accessible e.g., through:
  statistics = 
  case.Examinations[0].Series[0].ImageStack.GetIntensityStatistics(RoiName="")
  
  average = statistics["Average"]
  for pair in average:
    print str(pair.Key) + " " + str(pair.Value)
  Parameters:
    RoiName - Name of ROI which to compute the statistics 
      inside. If left empty, the outline ROI will be used.
  Returns:
    The ROI statistic.

OutlineMbsMesh.description:
OutlineMbsMesh(..)
  Creates an external MBS model based on the external geometry on 
  the "model examination" and stores it in the data base (for future 
  use).
  Create external MBS meshes for the selected images based on the 
  external MBS model.
  Parameters:
    ExternalMbsRoiName - The name of the external MBS ROI to 
      create.
    ExternalMbsRoiColor - The color of the external MBS ROI to 
      create.
      Default value is Yellow.
    ModelExaminationName - The name of the examination used to 
      create an outline MBS model from.
    TargetExaminationNames - The name(s) of the examination(s) 
      for which to create an outline MBS roigeometry.
    SuperiorInferiorRange - The sup-inf range interval for 
      which the external MBS should be defined for (on the model 
      examination geometry).
      If SuperiorInferiorRange is set to [0,0] the range covered by 
      the complete external geometry will be used.
      Use the script extension utility method 
      StructureSet.GetSuperiorInferiorRangeForExternalGeometry() for 
      guidance when a smaller range is wanted.
    UseExistingExternalMbsModel - If to use an existing 
      external MBS model.
      If an external MBS model exists and 
      UseExistingExternalMbsModel == false, the model stored in the 
      data base is removed and a new is created.
      This option can only be used if no external MBS geometries 
      exist (i.e., when the external MBS ROI has been removed).

ImportDeformableRegistrationFromMetaImag.description:
ImportDeformableRegistrationFromMetaImageFile(..)
  Action for reading a deformable registration stored as a meta 
  image file.
  Assumes that all units are mm (corner, grid element size and 
  displacement)
  Displacement field should be stored as float (ELEMENT_TYPE = 
  MET_FLOAT in header file)
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExaminationName - Gets or sets the name of the 
      reference examination.
    TargetExaminationName - Gets or sets the name of the 
      target examination.
    DeformableRegistrationGroupName - Gets or sets the name of 
      the deformable registration group that will be created.
    RigidTransform - Gets or sets the rigid transform for the 
      deformable registration.
      If null, the identity matrix will be assumed.
      In RayStation, two frame-of-references have a unique 
      registration, meaning there is only support for one 
      frame-of-reference registration between two image sets. 
      In addition to the frame-of-reference registration an 
      additional rigid transform can be created and stored (below 
      refered to as "added rigid transform"). 
      The combination of the frame-of-reference registration and the 
      added rigid transform will be the starting point for the 
      deformable registration. 
      This means that the parameter "RigidTransform" need to fulfil 
      one of the following:If the reference image and the target 
      image are already rigidly registered in RayStation the 
      transform need to fulfil:
      1. no frame-of-reference registration exists between reference 
      and target
          -> frame-of-reference registration will be set to 
      "RigidTransform" and added rigid transform to identity 
      2. identical to the frame-of-reference registration between 
      reference and target AND no added rigid transform between the 
      image set exists
          -> added rigid transform will be set to identity 
      3. identical to the combined frame-of-reference registration 
      and added rigid transform between the image sets
      4. difference than the frame-of-reference registration between 
      reference and target AND no added rigid transform exists
          -> added rigid transform will be set to the difference 
      between the frame-of-reference registration and "RigidTransform"
      Independently of the situation, no added rigid transform can 
      be added once the action is finished (as only one can exist 
      between the same set of images)
                  
      If RigidTransform is empty, existing transform will be used.
    MetaImageHeaderFileName - Gets or sets the file name for 
      the meta file in which the displacement field is given.

GetTotalTransformForExaminations.description:
GetTotalTransformForExaminations(..)
  Gets the rigid transform between two examinations based on their 
  frame-of-reference registration (typically created by treatment 
  position alignment) and additional rigid transform. 
  If no additional rigid transform exists, only frame-of-reference 
  registration is used.
  Parameters:
    FromExamination - Name of FromExamination
    ToExamination - Name of ToExamination
  Returns:
    Rigid transform as double array. Returns null if no 
    transform exists.

SetRegistrationAsTreatmentPositionAlignm.description:
SetRegistrationAsTreatmentPositionAlignment(..)
  Sets a frame-of reference registration as treatment position 
  alignment.
  To be able to use this functionality a frame-of-reference 
  registration with the fraction image set as floating image set and 
  the the planning image set as reference image set has to exist.
  Note: A treatment position alignment corresponds to the 
  relationship between the planning image set and the actual 
  treatment position during the fraction.
  Hence, only set a frame-of-reference registration corresponding to 
  the relationship between the planning image set and the actual 
  treatment position as being treatment position alignment.
  Parameters:
    FractionExamination - The image set acquired during 
      treatment.
      This image set needs to be assigned to a fraction.
    PlanningExamination - The planning image set of the plan 
      for which treatment adaptation has been initialized.

SimilarityForRigidlyMappedRoiGeometry.description:
SimilarityForRigidlyMappedRoiGeometry(..)
   Maps a RoiGeometry RG in the "from" image to the "to" image 
  using a rigid transform, resulting in RG_map, 
   and computes similarity measures between RG_map, below denoted 
  ROIB, and RG, below denoted ROIA, in the target image.
   
   Dice similarity coefficient/index - DSC (also called Dice's 
  coefficient or Sorensen index): 
             2 | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA | + | ROIB |
   DSC range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   DSC with reference to:
   Dice, "Measures of the amount of ecologic association between 
  species", Ecology 26:297–302 (1945)
              
   Precision:
            | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA union ROIB |
   Precision range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   Precision with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Specificity:
            1 - | ROIB not ROIA | / | ROIA |
   Specificity is 1 for a complete overlap, and otherwise less than 1
   Delineation specificity with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Sensitivity:
            | ROIA intersect ROIB | / | ROIA |
   Sensitivity range between 0 (no overlap) and 1 (complete overlap)
   Delineation sensitivity with reference to:
   Udupa et al, "A framework for evaluating image segmentation 
  algorithms", Computerized Medical Imaging and Graphics, 
  30(2):75-87 (2006)
              
   Mean distance to agreement (Mean DTA):
   Average distance for the surface of ROIA intersect ROIB to the 
  surface of ROIA union ROIB
   Measured using a distance transform based approach. Each point 
  (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be assigned the 
  minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface of the 
  reference roi. 
   Mean DTA is 0 for complete overlap. If no overlap, infinity is 
  assigned
   Unit is cm
              
   Max distance to agreement (Max DTA):
   Maximum distance for the surface of ROIA intersect ROIB to the 
  surface of ROIA union ROIB
   Measured using a distance transform based approach. Each point 
  (/voxel) on the surface of the target roi will be assigned the 
  minimum distance to a point (/voxel) on the surface of the 
  reference roi. 
   Max DTA is 0 for complete overlap. If no overlap, infinity is 
  assigned
   Unit is cm
   
   Use Patient.GetTransformForExaminations or 
  Patient.GetTotalTransformForExaminations to get the rigid 
  transformation.
  Parameters:
    FromImageName - Name of the from image.
    ToImageName - Name of the to image.
    RoiGeometryName - Name of RoiGeometry to investigate.
    RigidTransformation - Rigid transformation as a double 
      array.
  Returns:
    Dictionary with measure name and value.

AddBeamSetsToAdaptedPlan.description:
AddBeamSetsToAdaptedPlan(..)
  Action for adding beamsets to an adapted plan.
  Prerequisite:
    Can only be used on adapted plans with no beam set(s)
              
  Example:
  # add new adapted plan from fraction 10 to a plan with one beam 
  set using planning image "RESCAN"
  patient = get_current("Patient")
  case = get_current("Case")
  plan=get_current("Plan")
  beam_set=get_current("BeamSet")
  adapt_from_fx = 10
  adapted_ct = "RESCAN"
  tot_nr_fx = len([tf for tf in 
  plan.TreatmentCourse.TreatmentFractions])
              
  adapted_plan = case.AddNewAdaptivePlan(FractionNumber= 
  adapt_from_fx, AdaptToPlanName= plan.Name, 
  UseTreatmentDeliveryAsSource= True,
  PlanName= "Adapted plan", PlannedBy= None, Comment= "", 
  ExaminationName= adapted_ct, AllowDuplicateNames= False)
  treatment_technique = beam_set.GetTreatmentTechniqueType()
              
  beam_set_settings = {'NumberOfRemainingFractions': tot_nr_fx - 
  adapt_from_fx, 'MachineName': 
  beam_set.MachineReference.MachineName, 
  'CreateSetupBeams': true, 'DicomPlanLabelOfOriginalBeamSet': 
  beam_set.DicomPlanLabel, 'ClearBeamModifiers': false, 
  'RemoveBeams': false, 'TreatmentTechnique': treatment_technique}
  adapted_plan.AddBeamSetsToAdaptedPlan(AdaptedBeamSets=[beam_set_settings])
  
  adapted_beam_set = adapted_plan.BeamSets[0]
  prescription = beam_set.Prescription.PrimaryDosePrescription
  adapted_beam_set.AddDosePrescriptionToRoi(
  RoiName=prescription.OnStructure.Name,
  DoseVolume=prescription.DoseVolume,
  PrescriptionType=prescription.PrescriptionType,
  DoseValue=prescription.DoseValue,
  RelativePrescriptionLevel=prescription.RelativePrescriptionLevel,
  AutoScaleDose=False)
  Parameters:
    AdaptedBeamSets - List of AdaptedBeamSetSettings
      Settings is stored as a dictionary on form 
      "NumberOfRemainingFractions", "MachineName",
      "CreateSetupBeams", "DicomPlanLabelOfOriginalBeamSet",
      "ClearBeamModifiers", "RemoveBeams", "TreatmentTechnique"
                  
      NumberOfRemainingFractions - Number of remaining fractions.
      MachineName - Name of the machine. The last commissioned 
      machine in the database will be used.
      CreateSetupBeams - Set to true if setupbeams shall be created.
      ClearBeamModifiers - Set to true if beam contents shall be 
      cleared.
      RemoveBeams - Set to true if all beams should be removed.
      NOTE - If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true, 
      beams will be removed. If both are false nothing will be done.

AddNewBeamSet.description:
AddNewBeamSet(..)
  Adds a new beam set.
  Parameters:
    Name - The name of the new beam set.
    ExaminationName - The name of the examination on which the 
      beam set is defined.
    MachineName - The name on the treatment machine. The 
      latest commissioned version og this machine will be used.
    Modality - The treatment modality.
      * Photons
      * Protons
      * Carbon
      * Electrons
    TreatmentTechnique - Treatment technique.
      * Conformal                - Photons 3DCRT treatment technique.
      * SMLC                     - Photons SMLC treatment technique.
      * VMAT                     - Photons VMAT treatment technique
      * DMLC                     - Photons DMLC.
      * StaticArc                - Photons static arc.
      * TomoHelical              - Photons tomo helical.
      * ProtonPencilBeamScanning - Protons pencil beam scanning.
      * LineScanning             - Protons line scanning.
      * UniformScanning          - Protons uniform scanning.
      * Wobbling                 - Protons wobbling scanning.
      * SingleScattering         - Protons single scattering.
      * DoubleScattering         - Protons double scattering.
      * ApplicatorAndCutout      - Electrons applicator and cutout.
      * CarbonPencilBeamScanning - Carbon pencil beam scanning.
    PatientPosition - Specifies the position of the patient 
      relative to the treatment/image equipment space.
      * HeadFirstProne
      * HeadFirstSupine
      * FeetFirstProne
      * FeetFirstSupine
      * HeadFirstDecubitusLeft
      * HeadFirstDecubitusRight
      * FeetFirstDecubitusLeft
      * FeetFirstDecubitusRight
    NumberOfFractions - The number of fractions in the new 
      beam set.
    CreateSetupBeams - Whether setup beams shall be created in 
      this beam set.
    UseLocalizationPointAsSetupIsocenter - True to use 
      localization point instead of isocenter from treatment beams 
      for the setup beams
    Comment - The beam set comment
    RbeModelReference - The RBE model to use for an ion 
      radiation set; or null if no RBE model is used
    EnableDynamicTrackingForVero - Indicates if Dynamic 
      tracking for the Vero Linac is enabled or disabled

UpdateDependencyForAdaptedPlan.description:
UpdateDependencyForAdaptedPlan()
  Action for setting dependency for new adapted plan.

TreatmentPlans.Comments:
Align lasers to Ant_Tattoo, to Right_Tattoo and to Left_Tattoo

FSD at isocenter "Iso 1":
Anterior      : 84.9 cm
Left_Lateral  : 78.8 cm
Right_Lateral : 90.4 cm


Position patient such that lasers line up with patient marks.
Move the isocentre according to the PATIENT coordinate system:
    RIGHT 6.3 cm (patient's right).
    SUPERIOR 0.0 cm.
    POSTERIOR 5.0 cm.


XVI Isocenter: X=-54.7 mm    Y=34.5 mm    Z=-286.3 mm

For Delta-4 Verification PRE-TREATMENT.
And EPID dosimetry without open Images.

100% Agility transfer

CreateElectronBeam.description:
CreateElectronBeam(..)
  Creates and adds a beam of electron type.
  Parameters:
    ApplicatorName - Name of the electron applicator.
    Energy - Energy [MeV] of the beam.
    InsertName - Name of the collimating insert in the 
      applicator.
    IsAddCutoutChecked - Gets, sets if cutout should be added
    IsocenterData - Dictionary containing isocenter data. Use 
      help functions to create IsocenterData. 
      Example: IsocenterData = beam_set.GetIsocenterData(Name="Iso 
      1") or IsocenterData = 
      beam_set.CreateDefaultIsocenterData(Position={'x':1, 'y':2, 
      'z':3} )
    Name - Beam name, must be unique.
    Description - Description.
    GantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CouchAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CollimatorAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.

AutoBreastAddRoisAndBeams.description:
AutoBreastAddRoisAndBeams(..)
  For auto breast planning only.
  Creates beams with initial segments.
  Creates 'aTreated Volume', aAvoid, aBreast, aCTV, modCAVITY, 
  CTVcavity, PTVcavity, DEVcavity,
  Creates aHumerus, blockHumerus, blockCavity, blockHEART, 
  blockAVOID, evalLTLUNG, evalRTLUNG, aChestwall, blockChestwall, 
  blockCOMP, blockWire
  Creates optimization beams, creates optimization problem, creates 
  clinical goals.
  Parameters:
    NominalEnergy - Nominal energy for the beams.
    HighNominalEnergy - High nominal energy for the optimized 
      beams (optional).
    SUPName - Superior POI.
    INFName - Inferior POI.
    MEDName - Medial POI.
    LATName - Lateral POI.
    ANTName - Anterior POI.
    SeparationThreshold - Separation threshold.

AddDosePrescriptionToPoi.description:
AddDosePrescriptionToPoi(..)
  Defines a prescription to the beam set dose. If the beamset has 
  background dose, the prescription will relate to the plan dose.
  Parameters:
    PoiName - Name of the poi the prescription will be defined 
      on.
    DoseValue - The prescribed dose [cGy].
    RelativePrescriptionLevel - The relative prescription 
      level, or prescription percentage. 
      For default behaviour, set to 1.0. 
      If set to for instance 0.95 it shall be interpreted in the 
      following way (for PrescriptionType = AverageDose, DoseValue = 
      4000 cGy):
                  
      95% of the Average dose in the roi shall be 4000 cGy. 
                  
      (The actual average dose in the roi will be the 4000 cGy 
      divided by 0.95)
    AutoScaleDose - True if the planning dose should 
      automatically be kept scaled to the prescribed dose.

CreateReport.description:
CreateReport(..)
  Create treatment plan report
  For any clinical report creation, warnings must be handled by 
  first exporting with IgnoreWarnings set to False.
  Use a try - except pattern to catch all warnings. After the 
  warnings have been handled the export can run again with this 
  parameter set to True.
  Code snippet:
  try:
    beam_set.CreateReport(... IgnoreWarnings=False)
  except SystemError as error:
    HandleWarnings(error)
    beam_set.CreateReport(... IgnoreWarnings=True)
  Parameters:
    templateName - Name of treatment plan report template
    filename - Filename for pdf document
    ignoreWarnings - Ignore warnings

CreateQAPlan.description:
CreateQAPlan(..)
  Creates a QA plan for a beam set.
  Parameters:
    PhantomName - The name of the phantom used for the QA 
      plan. Requierd property.
    PhantomId - The ID of the phantom used for the QA plan. 
      Required property.
    QAPlanName - The name of the QA plan. Required property. 
      The name of the QA plan must be unique among the QA plans for 
      the same treatment plan beam set.
    IsoCenter - The position of the isocenter in the phantom. 
      Expressed in the DICOM coordinate system.
    DoseGrid - The resolution of the QA plan dose grid. The 
      dose grid is constructed to cover the outline of the phantom.
    GantryAngle - The value of the gantry angle(s) for the 
      beams in the plan. Can be null. If a gantry angle is provided, 
      all beams in the plan will be 
      collapsed to this angle (all beams will have the same gantry 
      angle). If a gantry angle is not provided, the beams in the QA 
      plan will have
      the same gantry angles as the beams in the treatment plan. 
      Angles are defined as in IEC standard.
    CollimatorAngle - The value of the collimator angle(s) for 
      the beams in the plan. Can be null. If a collimator angle is 
      provided, all beams in the plan will be 
      collapsed to this angle (all beams will have the same 
      collimator angle). If a collimator angle is not provided, the 
      beams in the QA plan will have
      the same collimator angles as the beams in the treatment plan. 
      Angles are defined as in IEC standard.
    CouchAngle - The value of the couch angle(s) for the beams 
      in the plan. Can be null. If a couch angle is provided all 
      beams in the plan will be 
      collapsed to this angle (all beams will have the same couch 
      angle). If a couch angle is not provided, the beams in the QA 
      plan will have
      the same couch angles as the beams in the treatment plan. 
      Angles are defined as in IEC standard.
    ComputeDoseWhenPlanIsCreated - A switch for computing the 
      dose for the QA plan when it is created.
    NumberOfMonteCarloHistories - Number of Monte Carlo 
      histories (for ElectronMonteCarlo)

SetTreatmentTechnique.description:
SetTreatmentTechnique(..)

  Parameters:

NormalizeToPrescription.description:
NormalizeToPrescription(..)
  Scales dose and the MU of the corresponding beam set.
  Parameters:
    RoiName - Name of ROI or POI used for dose scaling.
    DoseValue - Dose value to scale to in cGy. 
      Must be in the interval 10 to 100000.
    DoseVolume - Percent volume used for scaling of 
      prescription type DoseAtVolume.
      Absolute volume (cm^3) used for scaling of prescription type 
      DoseAtAbsoluteVolume.
      Must be in the interval 0 to 100 for prescription type 
      DoseAtVolume.
      Must be in the interval 0 to volume of ROI for prescription 
      type DoseAtAbsoluteVolume.
    PrescriptionType - Prescription type for scaling. Possible 
      values:
      * AverageDose:          The average dose of the selected ROI 
      is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      disregarded.
      * DoseAtVolume:         The dose at the given percent volume 
      of the select ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs.
      * DoseAtAbsoluteVolume: The dose at the given absolute volume 
      (cm^3) of the selected ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs.
      * DoseAtPoint:          The given point dose is scaled.
                              Can only be used for POIs.
      * NearMinimumDose:      The dose at 98 % volume of the 
      selected ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      set to 98.
      * NearMaximumDose:      The dose at 2 % volume of the selected 
      ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      set to 2.
      * MedianDose:           The dose at 50 % volume of the 
      selected ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      set to 50.
    LockedBeamNames - List of names of the beams that should 
      not be scaled.
      Default value is null.
    EvaluateAfterScaling - Indicates if the optimization 
      function values should be evaluated after scaling.
      Default is false.

CreateReportFromTemplateFile.description:
CreateReportFromTemplateFile(..)
  Create treatment plan report from template file
  For any clinical report creation, warnings must be handled by 
  first exporting with IgnoreWarnings set to False.
  Use a try - except pattern to catch all warnings. After the 
  warnings have been handled the export can run again with this 
  parameter set to True.
  Code snippet:
  try:
    beam_set.CreateReportFromTemplateFile(... IgnoreWarnings=False)
  except SystemError as error:
    HandleWarnings(error)
    beam_set.CreateReportFromTemplateFile(... IgnoreWarnings=True)
  Parameters:
    templateFileName - template file name (full path)
    filename - Filename for pdf document
    ignoreWarnings - Ignore warnings

UpdateSetupBeams.description:
UpdateSetupBeams(..)
  Updates setup beams
  Parameters:
    ResetSetupBeams - If true all existing setup beams will be 
      unconditionally removed and replaced with default beams.
    SetupBeamsGantryAngles - If set, a setup beam is created 
      for each gantry angle in the list

DeliverPlanOnMultipleImageSets.description:
DeliverPlanOnMultipleImageSets(..)
  Computes dose on multiple examinations, using selected beams and 
  segments for each examination.
  (Only PBS (clinical), SMLC and VMAT (non-clinical) supported so 
  far.)
  Parameters:
    FractionNumber - The number of the fraction for which the 
      dose is to be computed. Default is 0.
    SegmentWeightsPerExamination - A dictionary of what 
      segments and beams should be computed on which examinations.
      First the examination is given, then the beam name, and 
      finally the segment number and the corresponding weight for 
      that examination.
      Example: SegmentWeightsPerExamination = { 'CT 1' : { 'Beam 1' 
      : { '0' : 0.5, '2': 0.2 } }, 'CT 2' : { 'Beam 1' : { '0': 0.5, 
      '1': 1, '2': 0.8 } } }

SetIdcasProperties.description:
SetIdcasProperties(..)
  Sets the patient setup and imaging protocol ID:s for the current 
  beam set 
  required for integration with the IDCAS collision avoidance 
  modules by medPhoton.
  The id:s are communicated through the following DICOM private tags: 
    - medPhoton private creator (30BB,0010) Type 1, VR LO, VM 1 
  Private creator identifier, always "medPhoton 1.0".
    - Patient Setup ID          (30BB,1000) Type 2, VR SH, VM 1 The 
  (unique) identifier to correlate with a specified patient setup.
    - Imaging Protocol ID       (30BB,1001) Type 2, VR SH, VM 1 The 
  (unique) identifier to correlate with a specified imaging protocol.
  Parameters:
    PatientSetupId - The patient setup ID. Unique identifier 
      to correlate with a specific patient setup.
      Must not exceed 16 characters and can only contain letters, 
      digits, underscores, dashes, or dots.
      DICOM private tag Patient Setup ID (30BB,1000).
      If only PatientSetupId is set the ImagingProtocolId will be 
      cleared.
    ImagingProtocolId - The imaging protocol ID. Unique 
      identifier to correlate with a specific imaging protocol.
      Must not exceed 16 characters and can only contain letters, 
      digits, underscores, dashes, or dots.
      DICOM private tag (30BB,1001).

    GantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CouchAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CollimatorAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.

SetMarginExpression.description:
SetMarginExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI expression representing a margin 
  (expansion/contraction). Should be followed by 
  UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the geometry for a 
  specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

GrayLevelThreshold.description:
GrayLevelThreshold(..)
  Gray level thresholding.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    LowThreshold - The low threshold. The unit is in rescaled 
      pixel values, e.g. HU for CT. For PET images, PetUnit must be 
      specified.
    HighThreshold - The high threshold. The unit is in 
      rescaled pixel values, e.g., HU for CT. For PET images, 
      PetUnit must be specified.
    PetUnit - The unit for PET images. Common values:
      * Bq/ml (activity concentration)
      * g/ml (SUV)
    BoundingBox - The bounding box. If specified, only pixels 
      located inside the bounding box are thresholded, pixels 
      outside are ignored. If not specified the whole image set is 
      thresholded. The bounding box is defined by the minimum and 
      maximum corners, MinCorner and MaxCorner.
      Example:
         To consider the bounding box defined by the points (x_min, 
      y_min, z_min) and (x_max, y_max, z_max), set 
      BoundingBox={"MinCorner":{'x':x_min, 'y':y_min, 'z':z_min}, 
      'MaxCorner':{'x':x_max, 'y':y_max, 'z':z_max}}

CreateCylinderGeometry.description:
CreateCylinderGeometry(..)
  Create a cylinder geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the cylinder geometry.
    Axis - The axis (cm) of the cylinder geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Length - The length (cm) of the cylinder geometry along 
      Axis.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

AdaptMbsMesh.description:
AdaptMbsMesh(..)
  Adapts an MBS mesh to the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    CustomStatistics - Custom graylevel statistics.
    CustomSettings - Custom MBS settings.

SetAsExternal.description:
SetAsExternal()
  Sets this region of interest as the external ROI. If an external 
  ROI already exists, it will be replaced by this one.

CreateExternalGeometries.description:
CreateExternalGeometries(..)
  Creates external geometries for the ROI on the specified 
  examinations.
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExamination - The reference examination.
    AdditionalExaminationNames - The additional examination 
      names.
    ReferenceThresholdLevel - The threshold level that 
      determines the outline. Set to None in order to automatically 
      calculate threshold value.
      This threshold level is used for all additional examinations 
      of same modality.

CreateMarginGeometry.description:
CreateMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a margin geometry (expansion/contraction).
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

CreateControllingRoiGeometry.description:
CreateControllingRoiGeometry(..)
  Creates controlling ROI geometry for a ROI geometry on a target 
  examination using a controlling ROI geometry on a reference 
  examination
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExaminationName - The name of the examination on 
      which the controlling ROI has a geometry defined.
    TargetExaminationNames - The names of the examinations on 
      which to create a controlling ROI geometry.
    RoiGeometryName - The name of the ROI geometry which the 
      controlling ROI should adapt to.
    SmoothingRadius - Applies a morphological close and open 
      with a structuring element of the given radius 
      (in cm) before creating / adapting the triangle mesh. If set 
      to 0, no smoothing will be done.

SetRoiMaterial.description:
SetRoiMaterial(..)
  Assigns a new material to this ROI. The material density will 
  override the ROI density for dose computation on all image sets.
  Parameters:
    Material - The new material.

TransformROI3D.description:
TransformROI3D(..)
  Performs a 3D transformation of the ROI
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is 
      transformed
    TransformationMatrix - The transformation matrix
      Example:
        Move the geometry 1 cm in every direction
        TransformationMatrix = {'M11':1, 'M12':0, 'M13':0, 'M14':1,
                                'M21':0, 'M22':1, 'M23':0, 'M24':1,
                                'M31':0, 'M32':0, 'M33':1, 'M34':1,
                                'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1}
                  
      The scaling of the transformation matrix must be positive
      The last row of the transformation matrix must be the 
      following: 'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1

DeleteRoi.description:
DeleteRoi()
  Action for deleting an ROI.

VolumeThreshold.description:
VolumeThreshold(..)
  Threshold ROI geometry based on volume, i.e., keep components of 
  input ROI geometry having volume in interval [MinVolume, 
  MaxVolume] cm3.
  Typically used to clean up after a gray-level thresholding or 
  region-growing operation.
  Parameters:
    InputRoi - The input ROI.
    Examination - The examination.
    MinVolume - The minimum volume (cm3).
    MaxVolume - The maximum volume (cm3).

MultiSpectralThreshold.description:
MultiSpectralThreshold(..)
  Multispectral thresholding of examinations in a MR protocol 
  group. 
  For each examination, LowThreshold and HighThreshold should be 
  given. 
  The resulting segmented region will consist of points which are in 
  the given (examination specific) range for each examination.
  RoiGeometries will be created on each examination.
  Parameters:
    ExaminationNames - The examination names. All selected 
      examinations need to be in the same MR protocol group
    LowThresholds - The low thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations
    HighThresholds - The high thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations

CreateBoxGeometry.description:
CreateBoxGeometry(..)
  Create a box geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Size - The size (cm) of the box geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

CreateExternalGeometry.description:
CreateExternalGeometry(..)
  Creates an external geometry for the ROI on the specified 
  examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    ThresholdLevel - The threshold level that determines the 
      outline. Set to None in order to automatically calculate 
      threshold value.

SetAlgebraExpression.description:
SetAlgebraExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI algebra expression. The expression is defined 
  with two expressions, ExpressionA and ExpressionB, and the 
  combination of these. Should be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry 
  in order to create the geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

SetWallExpression.description:
SetWallExpression(..)
  Sets a derived expression representing a wall geometry. Should 
  be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the 
  geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

CreateSphereGeometry.description:
CreateSphereGeometry(..)
  Create a sphere geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the sphere geometry.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

UpdateDerivedGeometry.description:
UpdateDerivedGeometry(..)
  Updates the derived geometry for the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".

CreateFieldOfViewROI.description:
CreateFieldOfViewROI(..)
  Creates field-of-view ROI on a CBCT or CT image
  Parameters:
    ExaminationName - The name of the examination on which a 
      field-of-view ROI geometry will be created.

DeleteExpression.description:
DeleteExpression()
  Deletes the derived ROI expression.

CreateITV.description:
CreateITV(..)
  Creates an ITV ROI from the geometries of a source ROI in 
  several examinations. 
  The ITV geometry is the union of the geometries in the source ROI, 
  with margins applied as a final step.
  Parameters:
    SourceRegionOfInterest - The source ROI, which must have 
      geometry in all provided examinations.
    ExaminationNames - List of examinations by name. These 
      examinations must be in the same 4D examination group.
    MarginSettingsData - Margins applied to the union of the 
      geometries of the source ROI in the provided examinations.

CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry.description:
CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a beam specific margin ROI geometry by expansion in 
  distal, proximal and lateral directions relative either to the 
  chosen beam or to the chosen manual direction.
  - Note that there is no dependency between the resulting margin 
  ROI geometry and the source ROI geometry or the selected beam.
    If any of those are changed, the margin ROI geometry becomes 
  obsolete and must be regenerated.
  - Note that the margin distances are geometrical, not radiological.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source ROI.
    Beam - A beam defining the direction. Must be defined if 
      Direction is undefined.
    Direction - The direction in DICOM patient coordinates. 
      Must be defined if Beam is undefined.
    DistalDistance - The distal distance in cm.
    ProximalDistance - The proximal distance in cm.
    LateralDistance - The lateral distance in cm.

CreateAlgebraGeometry.description:
CreateAlgebraGeometry(..)
  Creates an algebra geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

ComputeDose.description:
ComputeDose(..)
  Compute dose on a beam set.
  Parameters:
    ComputeBeamDoses - Indicates if beam doses shall be 
      computed. Default is true.
    DoseAlgorithm - * CCDose: Clinical dose engine for photons 
      based on a collapsed-cone dose algorithm. Used for final dose 
      computations of all photon delivery techniques.
      * ElectronMonteCarlo: Clinical dose engine for electrons based 
      on a Monte Carlo dose algorithm. Used for final dose 
      computations of electron plans.
      * IonMonteCarlo: Clinical dose engine for protons based on an 
      ion Monte Carlo dose algorithm. Used for final dose 
      computations of PBS plans.
      * SpotWeightPencilBeam: Clinical dose engine for protons based 
      on a pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for optimization and 
      final dose computations of PBS plans.
      * IonPencilBeam: Clinical dose engine for protons based on a 
      pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for final dose computations 
      of US/DS/Wobbling plans.
      * CarbonPencilBeam: Clinical dose engine for carbon ions based 
      on a pencil beam dose algorithm. In the presence of an RBE 
      model, both physical and RBE weighted dose are computed. Used 
      for optimization and final dose computations of PBS plans.
      * SpotWeightPencilBeamFast: Approximate dose engine for 
      protons based on a pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for fast, 
      approximate dose computations in the optimization of PBS plans.
      * IonPencilBeamFast: Approximate dose engine for protons based 
      on a pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for fast, approximate 
      dose computations of US/DS/Wobbling plans.
    ForceRecompute - Set to true to force recomputation of 
      dose even if a current dose with the same dose engine already 
      exists. Default is false.

AddDosePrescriptionToRoi.description:
AddDosePrescriptionToRoi(..)
  Defines a prescription to the beam set dose. If the beamset has 
  background dose, the prescription will relate to the plan dose.
  Parameters:
    RoiName - Name of the roi the prescription will be defined 
      on.
    DoseVolume - The relative volume that should recieve at 
      least the prescribed dose (percentage). Only applicable for 
      prescription type DoseAtVolume.
    PrescriptionType - Available prescription types are:
      * AverageDose: The average dose of the structure volume shall 
      receive the prescribed dose.
      * DoseAtVolume: A percentage of the structure volume, set in 
      DoseVolume, shall recieve the prescribed dose.
      * MedianDose: 50% of the structure volume shall receive the 
      prescribed dose.
      * NearMaximumDose: 2% of the structure volume shall receive 
      the prescribed dose.
      * NearMinimumDose: 98% of the structure volume shall receive 
      the prescribed dose.
    DoseValue - The prescribed dose [cGy].
    RelativePrescriptionLevel - The relative prescription 
      level, or prescription percentage. 
      For default behaviour, set to 1.0. 
      If set to for instance 0.95 it shall be interpreted in the 
      following way (for PrescriptionType = AverageDose, DoseValue = 
      4000 cGy):
                  
      95% of the Average dose in the roi shall be 4000 cGy. 
                  
      (The actual average dose in the roi will be the 4000 cGy 
      divided by 0.95)
    AutoScaleDose - True if the planning dose should 
      automatically be kept scaled to the prescribed dose.

CreateReport.description:
CreateReport(..)
  Create treatment plan report
  For any clinical report creation, warnings must be handled by 
  first exporting with IgnoreWarnings set to False.
  Use a try - except pattern to catch all warnings. After the 
  warnings have been handled the export can run again with this 
  parameter set to True.
  Code snippet:
  try:
    beam_set.CreateReport(... IgnoreWarnings=False)
  except SystemError as error:
    HandleWarnings(error)
    beam_set.CreateReport(... IgnoreWarnings=True)
  Parameters:
    templateName - Name of treatment plan report template
    filename - Filename for pdf document
    ignoreWarnings - Ignore warnings

CreateQAPlan.description:
CreateQAPlan(..)
  Creates a QA plan for a beam set.
  Parameters:
    PhantomName - The name of the phantom used for the QA 
      plan. Requierd property.
    PhantomId - The ID of the phantom used for the QA plan. 
      Required property.
    QAPlanName - The name of the QA plan. Required property. 
      The name of the QA plan must be unique among the QA plans for 
      the same treatment plan beam set.
    IsoCenter - The position of the isocenter in the phantom. 
      Expressed in the DICOM coordinate system.
    DoseGrid - The resolution of the QA plan dose grid. The 
      dose grid is constructed to cover the outline of the phantom.
    GantryAngle - The value of the gantry angle(s) for the 
      beams in the plan. Can be null. If a gantry angle is provided, 
      all beams in the plan will be 
      collapsed to this angle (all beams will have the same gantry 
      angle). If a gantry angle is not provided, the beams in the QA 
      plan will have
      the same gantry angles as the beams in the treatment plan. 
      Angles are defined as in IEC standard.
    CollimatorAngle - The value of the collimator angle(s) for 
      the beams in the plan. Can be null. If a collimator angle is 
      provided, all beams in the plan will be 
      collapsed to this angle (all beams will have the same 
      collimator angle). If a collimator angle is not provided, the 
      beams in the QA plan will have
      the same collimator angles as the beams in the treatment plan. 
      Angles are defined as in IEC standard.
    CouchAngle - The value of the couch angle(s) for the beams 
      in the plan. Can be null. If a couch angle is provided all 
      beams in the plan will be 
      collapsed to this angle (all beams will have the same couch 
      angle). If a couch angle is not provided, the beams in the QA 
      plan will have
      the same couch angles as the beams in the treatment plan. 
      Angles are defined as in IEC standard.
    ComputeDoseWhenPlanIsCreated - A switch for computing the 
      dose for the QA plan when it is created.
    NumberOfMonteCarloHistories - Number of Monte Carlo 
      histories (for ElectronMonteCarlo)

NormalizeToPrescription.description:
NormalizeToPrescription(..)
  Scales dose and the MU of the corresponding beam set.
  Parameters:
    RoiName - Name of ROI or POI used for dose scaling.
    DoseValue - Dose value to scale to in cGy. 
      Must be in the interval 10 to 100000.
    DoseVolume - Percent volume used for scaling of 
      prescription type DoseAtVolume.
      Absolute volume (cm^3) used for scaling of prescription type 
      DoseAtAbsoluteVolume.
      Must be in the interval 0 to 100 for prescription type 
      DoseAtVolume.
      Must be in the interval 0 to volume of ROI for prescription 
      type DoseAtAbsoluteVolume.
    PrescriptionType - Prescription type for scaling. Possible 
      values:
      * AverageDose:          The average dose of the selected ROI 
      is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      disregarded.
      * DoseAtVolume:         The dose at the given percent volume 
      of the select ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs.
      * DoseAtAbsoluteVolume: The dose at the given absolute volume 
      (cm^3) of the selected ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs.
      * DoseAtPoint:          The given point dose is scaled.
                              Can only be used for POIs.
      * NearMinimumDose:      The dose at 98 % volume of the 
      selected ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      set to 98.
      * NearMaximumDose:      The dose at 2 % volume of the selected 
      ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      set to 2.
      * MedianDose:           The dose at 50 % volume of the 
      selected ROI is scaled.
                              Cannot be used for POIs. DoseVolume is 
      set to 50.
    LockedBeamNames - List of names of the beams that should 
      not be scaled.
      Default value is null.
    EvaluateAfterScaling - Indicates if the optimization 
      function values should be evaluated after scaling.
      Default is false.

DeliverPlanOnMultipleImageSets.description:
DeliverPlanOnMultipleImageSets(..)
  Computes dose on multiple examinations, using selected beams and 
  segments for each examination.
  (Only PBS (clinical), SMLC and VMAT (non-clinical) supported so 
  far.)
  Parameters:
    FractionNumber - The number of the fraction for which the 
      dose is to be computed. Default is 0.
    SegmentWeightsPerExamination - A dictionary of what 
      segments and beams should be computed on which examinations.
      First the examination is given, then the beam name, and 
      finally the segment number and the corresponding weight for 
      that examination.
      Example: SegmentWeightsPerExamination = { 'CT 1' : { 'Beam 1' 
      : { '0' : 0.5, '2': 0.2 } }, 'CT 2' : { 'Beam 1' : { '0': 0.5, 
      '1': 1, '2': 0.8 } } }

SetIdcasProperties.description:
SetIdcasProperties(..)
  Sets the patient setup and imaging protocol ID:s for the current 
  beam set 
  required for integration with the IDCAS collision avoidance 
  modules by medPhoton.
  The id:s are communicated through the following DICOM private tags: 
    - medPhoton private creator (30BB,0010) Type 1, VR LO, VM 1 
  Private creator identifier, always "medPhoton 1.0".
    - Patient Setup ID          (30BB,1000) Type 2, VR SH, VM 1 The 
  (unique) identifier to correlate with a specified patient setup.
    - Imaging Protocol ID       (30BB,1001) Type 2, VR SH, VM 1 The 
  (unique) identifier to correlate with a specified imaging protocol.
  Parameters:
    PatientSetupId - The patient setup ID. Unique identifier 
      to correlate with a specific patient setup.
      Must not exceed 16 characters and can only contain letters, 
      digits, underscores, dashes, or dots.
      DICOM private tag Patient Setup ID (30BB,1000).
      If only PatientSetupId is set the ImagingProtocolId will be 
      cleared.
    ImagingProtocolId - The imaging protocol ID. Unique 
      identifier to correlate with a specific imaging protocol.
      Must not exceed 16 characters and can only contain letters, 
      digits, underscores, dashes, or dots.
      DICOM private tag (30BB,1001).

CreateRectangularField.description:
CreateRectangularField(..)
  Creates rectangular field.
  Parameters:
    Width - The width of the rectangular field in cm. Default 
      value is 1.0.
    Height - The height of the rectangular field in cm. 
      Default value is 1.0.
    CenterCoordinate - The center point of the rectangular 
      field in the beam coordinate system. 
      Default value is { 'x': 0, 'y': 0 }.
    MoveMLC - Indicates if the field should be collimated by 
      the MLC. Default value is true.
    MoveAllMLCLeaves - Indicates if all leafs should be moved 
      when adjusting MLC. Default value is false.
    MoveJaw - Indicates if the field should be collimated by 
      the jaws. Default value is true.

      { 'x': 0, 'y': 0 }.
    DeleteWedge - Indicates if the wedge of the beam should be 
      deleted. Default value is false.
    PreventExtraLeafPairFromOpening - If an extra leafpair 
      should be openend, it can be prevented using this property.

CreatePhotonBeam.description:
CreatePhotonBeam(..)
  Creates and adds a a photon beam.

      help functions to create IsocenterData. 
      Example: IsocenterData = beam_set.GetIsocenterData(Name="Iso 
      1") or IsocenterData = 
      beam_set.CreateDefaultIsocenterData(Position={'x':1, 'y':2, 
      'z':3} )

ReadOnlyPathChecking.description:

  module. Can only be used for approved beam sets and the collision 
  result is not saved to the beam set.
  Parameters:
    IgnoreImagingRing - Defines whether to ignore the imaging 
      ring and source from the path checking. 
      This option may be used when the positioning of the imaging 
      ring can be adjusted at a later stage.

LaunchIdcasSetupModule.description:
LaunchIdcasSetupModule(..)
  Asynchronuous action for launching the IDCAS patient setup 
  module (PS-M) or imaging definition module (ID-M).
  Parameters:
    ModuleType - The module type. Allowed values are 
      PatientSetup and ImagingDefinition.

SetMarginExpression.description:
SetMarginExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI expression representing a margin 
  (expansion/contraction). Should be followed by 
  UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the geometry for a 
  specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

GrayLevelThreshold.description:
GrayLevelThreshold(..)
  Gray level thresholding.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    LowThreshold - The low threshold. The unit is in rescaled 
      pixel values, e.g. HU for CT. For PET images, PetUnit must be 
      specified.
    HighThreshold - The high threshold. The unit is in 
      rescaled pixel values, e.g., HU for CT. For PET images, 
      PetUnit must be specified.
    PetUnit - The unit for PET images. Common values:
      * Bq/ml (activity concentration)
      * g/ml (SUV)
    BoundingBox - The bounding box. If specified, only pixels 
      located inside the bounding box are thresholded, pixels 
      outside are ignored. If not specified the whole image set is 
      thresholded. The bounding box is defined by the minimum and 
      maximum corners, MinCorner and MaxCorner.
      Example:
         To consider the bounding box defined by the points (x_min, 
      y_min, z_min) and (x_max, y_max, z_max), set 
      BoundingBox={"MinCorner":{'x':x_min, 'y':y_min, 'z':z_min}, 
      'MaxCorner':{'x':x_max, 'y':y_max, 'z':z_max}}

CreateCylinderGeometry.description:
CreateCylinderGeometry(..)
  Create a cylinder geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the cylinder geometry.
    Axis - The axis (cm) of the cylinder geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Length - The length (cm) of the cylinder geometry along 
      Axis.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

AdaptMbsMesh.description:
AdaptMbsMesh(..)
  Adapts an MBS mesh to the specified examination.

    CustomSettings - Custom MBS settings.

SetAsExternal.description:
SetAsExternal()

CreateExternalGeometries.description:
CreateExternalGeometries(..)
  Creates external geometries for the ROI on the specified 
  examinations.
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExamination - The reference examination.
    AdditionalExaminationNames - The additional examination 
      names.
    ReferenceThresholdLevel - The threshold level that 
      determines the outline. Set to None in order to automatically 
      calculate threshold value.
      This threshold level is used for all additional examinations 
      of same modality.

CreateMarginGeometry.description:
CreateMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a margin geometry (expansion/contraction).
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

CreateControllingRoiGeometry.description:
CreateControllingRoiGeometry(..)
  Creates controlling ROI geometry for a ROI geometry on a target 
  examination using a controlling ROI geometry on a reference 
  examination
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExaminationName - The name of the examination on 
      which the controlling ROI has a geometry defined.
    TargetExaminationNames - The names of the examinations on 
      which to create a controlling ROI geometry.
    RoiGeometryName - The name of the ROI geometry which the 
      controlling ROI should adapt to.
    SmoothingRadius - Applies a morphological close and open 
      with a structuring element of the given radius 
      (in cm) before creating / adapting the triangle mesh. If set 
      to 0, no smoothing will be done.

SetRoiMaterial.description:
SetRoiMaterial(..)
  Assigns a new material to this ROI. The material density will 
  override the ROI density for dose computation on all image sets.
  Parameters:
    Material - The new material.

TransformROI3D.description:
TransformROI3D(..)
  Performs a 3D transformation of the ROI
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is 
      transformed
    TransformationMatrix - The transformation matrix
      Example:
        Move the geometry 1 cm in every direction
        TransformationMatrix = {'M11':1, 'M12':0, 'M13':0, 'M14':1,
                                'M21':0, 'M22':1, 'M23':0, 'M24':1,
                                'M31':0, 'M32':0, 'M33':1, 'M34':1,
                                'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1}
                  
      The scaling of the transformation matrix must be positive
      The last row of the transformation matrix must be the 
      following: 'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1

DeleteRoi.description:
DeleteRoi()
  Action for deleting an ROI.

VolumeThreshold.description:
VolumeThreshold(..)
  Threshold ROI geometry based on volume, i.e., keep components of 
  input ROI geometry having volume in interval [MinVolume, 
  MaxVolume] cm3.
  Typically used to clean up after a gray-level thresholding or 
  region-growing operation.
  Parameters:
    InputRoi - The input ROI.
    Examination - The examination.
    MinVolume - The minimum volume (cm3).
    MaxVolume - The maximum volume (cm3).

MultiSpectralThreshold.description:
MultiSpectralThreshold(..)
  Multispectral thresholding of examinations in a MR protocol 
  group. 
  For each examination, LowThreshold and HighThreshold should be 
  given. 
  The resulting segmented region will consist of points which are in 
  the given (examination specific) range for each examination.
  RoiGeometries will be created on each examination.
  Parameters:
    ExaminationNames - The examination names. All selected 
      examinations need to be in the same MR protocol group
    LowThresholds - The low thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations
    HighThresholds - The high thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations

CreateBoxGeometry.description:
CreateBoxGeometry(..)
  Create a box geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Size - The size (cm) of the box geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

CreateExternalGeometry.description:
CreateExternalGeometry(..)
  Creates an external geometry for the ROI on the specified 
  examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    ThresholdLevel - The threshold level that determines the 
      outline. Set to None in order to automatically calculate 
      threshold value.

SetAlgebraExpression.description:
SetAlgebraExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI algebra expression. The expression is defined 
  with two expressions, ExpressionA and ExpressionB, and the 
  combination of these. Should be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry 
  in order to create the geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

SetWallExpression.description:
SetWallExpression(..)
  Sets a derived expression representing a wall geometry. Should 
  be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the 
  geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

CreateSphereGeometry.description:
CreateSphereGeometry(..)
  Create a sphere geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the sphere geometry.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

UpdateDerivedGeometry.description:
UpdateDerivedGeometry(..)
  Updates the derived geometry for the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".

CreateFieldOfViewROI(..)

DeleteExpression()
