CreateITV.description:
CreateITV(..)
  Creates an ITV ROI from the geometries of a source ROI in 
  several examinations. 
  The ITV geometry is the union of the geometries in the source ROI, 
  with margins applied as a final step.
  Parameters:
    SourceRegionOfInterest - The source ROI, which must have 
      geometry in all provided examinations.
    ExaminationNames - List of examinations by name. These 
      examinations must be in the same 4D examination group.
    MarginSettingsData - Margins applied to the union of the 
      geometries of the source ROI in the provided examinations.

CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry.description:
CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a beam specific margin ROI geometry by expansion in 
  distal, proximal and lateral directions relative either to the 
  chosen beam or to the chosen manual direction.
  - Note that there is no dependency between the resulting margin 
  ROI geometry and the source ROI geometry or the selected beam.
    If any of those are changed, the margin ROI geometry becomes 
  obsolete and must be regenerated.
  - Note that the margin distances are geometrical, not radiological.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source ROI.
    Beam - A beam defining the direction. Must be defined if 
      Direction is undefined.
    Direction - The direction in DICOM patient coordinates. 
      Must be defined if Beam is undefined.
    DistalDistance - The distal distance in cm.
    ProximalDistance - The proximal distance in cm.
    LateralDistance - The lateral distance in cm.

CreateAlgebraGeometry.description:
CreateAlgebraGeometry(..)
  Creates an algebra geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

CreateWallGeometry.description:
CreateWallGeometry(..)
  Creates a wall geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

EditShowBeamVisualization(..)

ComputeDoseOnAdditionalSets.description:
ComputeDoseOnAdditionalSets(..)
  Compute beam set dose on additional image sets.
  Parameters:
    OnlyOneDosePerImageSet - Indicates if only one evaluation 
      dose per image set shall be allowed. 
      Previously computed evaluation doses on the selected 
      examinations will be deleted if this is set to true.
      Default is false.
    AllowGridExpansion - Indicates if expansion of the dose 
      grid is allowed if necessary. Default is true.
    ExaminationNames - The names of the examinations to be 
      used. This is a required property and the number of items
      in this list must equal the number of items in the 
      FractionNumbers property.
    FractionNumbers - The numbers of the fractions for which 
      the dose is to be computed. This is a required property
      and the number of items in this list must equal the number of 
      items in the ExaminationNames property. 
      This property must contain at least one item.
    ComputeBeamDoses - Indicates if beam doses shall be 
      computed. Default is true.

HasImportedDose.description:
HasImportedDose()

SetBeamIsocenterColorVisualization.description:
SetBeamIsocenterColorVisualization()
  Setting the beam color display type: isocenter.

ComputeDose.description:
ComputeDose(..)
  Compute dose on a beam set.
  Parameters:
    ComputeBeamDoses - Indicates if beam doses shall be 
      computed. Default is true.
    DoseAlgorithm - * CCDose: Clinical dose engine for photons 
      based on a collapsed-cone dose algorithm. Used for final dose 
      computations of all photon delivery techniques.
      * ElectronMonteCarlo: Clinical dose engine for electrons based 
      on a Monte Carlo dose algorithm. Used for final dose 
      computations of electron plans.
      * IonMonteCarlo: Clinical dose engine for protons based on an 
      ion Monte Carlo dose algorithm. Used for final dose 
      computations of PBS plans.
      * SpotWeightPencilBeam: Clinical dose engine for protons based 
      on a pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for optimization and 
      final dose computations of PBS plans.
      * IonPencilBeam: Clinical dose engine for protons based on a 
      pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for final dose computations 
      of US/DS/Wobbling plans.
      * CarbonPencilBeam: Clinical dose engine for carbon ions based 
      on a pencil beam dose algorithm. In the presence of an RBE 
      model, both physical and RBE weighted dose are computed. Used 
      for optimization and final dose computations of PBS plans.
      * SpotWeightPencilBeamFast: Approximate dose engine for 
      protons based on a pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for fast, 
      approximate dose computations in the optimization of PBS plans.
      * IonPencilBeamFast: Approximate dose engine for protons based 
      on a pencil beam dose algorithm. Used for fast, approximate 
      dose computations of US/DS/Wobbling plans.
    ForceRecompute - Set to true to force recomputation of 
      dose even if a current dose with the same dose engine already 
      exists. Default is false.

      will be the centers of the views. Must be as many as the 
      Orientations.
    FocusOnIsocenter - Indicates if the image is centered on 
      the isocenter.
    ImageSize - The image size in nr of pixels. The 
      X-coordinate represents the width of the image [nr of pixels]. 
      The Y-coordinate represents the height of the image [nr of

      1") or IsocenterData = 
      beam_set.CreateDefaultIsocenterData(Position={'x':1, 'y':2, 
      'z':3} )
    Name - Beam name, must be unique.
    Description - Description.
    GantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CouchAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CollimatorAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.

BeamSetIdentifier.description:
BeamSetIdentifier()
  Returns a beam set identifier which can be used for dicom export
  Returns:
    Beam set identifier which can be used for dicom export

AddDosePrescriptionToRoi.description:
AddDosePrescriptionToRoi(..)
  Defines a prescription to the beam set dose. If the beamset has 
  background dose, the prescription will relate to the plan dose.
  Parameters:
    RoiName - Name of the roi the prescription will be defined 
      on.
    DoseVolume - The relative volume that should recieve at 
      least the prescribed dose (percentage). Only applicable for 
      prescription type DoseAtVolume.
    PrescriptionType - Available prescription types are:
      * AverageDose: The average dose of the structure volume shall 
      receive the prescribed dose.
      * DoseAtVolume: A percentage of the structure volume, set in 
      DoseVolume, shall recieve the prescribed dose.
      * MedianDose: 50% of the structure volume shall receive the 
      prescribed dose.
      * NearMaximumDose: 2% of the structure volume shall receive 
      the prescribed dose.
      * NearMinimumDose: 98% of the structure volume shall receive 
      the prescribed dose.
    DoseValue - The prescribed dose [cGy].
    RelativePrescriptionLevel - The relative prescription 
      level, or prescription percentage. 
      For default behaviour, set to 1.0. 
      If set to for instance 0.95 it shall be interpreted in the 
      following way (for PrescriptionType = AverageDose, DoseValue = 
      4000 cGy):
                  
      95% of the Average dose in the roi shall be 4000 cGy. 
                  
      (The actual average dose in the roi will be the 4000 cGy 
      divided by 0.95)
    AutoScaleDose - True if the planning dose should 
      automatically be kept scaled to the prescribed dose.

DeleteBeamSet.description:
DeleteBeamSet()
  Method for deleting a beam set.
  It is only possible to delete a beam set in a multiple beam set 
  plan, i.e., at least one beam set needs to remain after deletion.
  It is not possible to delete an approved beam set (neither 
  approved through beam set approval nor approved to use as 
  background dose)

EditDefaultPattern.description:
EditDefaultPattern(..)
  Edit the default pattern of the fractionation pattern.
  The start schedule is specified using a string of 1's and 0's, 
  where a 1 represents a fraction to be delivered and a 0 represents 
  a skipped fraction, 
  and a number that specifies the number of fractions per day in the 
  schedule.
  Example:
    Set a default pattern where two fractions are delivered 
    every weekday the first week and no fractions are delivered the 
    second week.
    fractionationPattern.EditDefaultPattern(ScheduleString='1111111111000000000000000000', NumberOfFractionsPerDay=2)
  Parameters:
    ScheduleString - The schedule string. Must be a multiple 
      of 7 and the number of fractions per day.
    NumberOfFractionsPerDay - The number of fractions per day 
      in the schedule string.

IsApprovedToUseAsBackgroundDose.description:
IsApprovedToUseAsBackgroundDose()
  Returns true if the dose has been approved to use as background 
  dose (hence an imported dose which is being considered as 
  clinical), false otherwise.

SetCurrent.description:
SetCurrent()
  Sets the current Beam Set

MergeAutoBreastBeams.description:
MergeAutoBreastBeams()
  Merge beams (A1 += A1_OPT, A2 += A2_OPT).
  Calculate CC dose.

CreateArcBeam.description:
CreateArcBeam(..)
  Creates and adds a beam of VMAT type.
  Parameters:
    ArcStopGantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    ArcRotationDirection - Rotation direction of the gantry.
      * Clockwise
      * CounterClockwise
    Energy - Energy for this beam (MV).
    IsocenterData - Dictionary containing isocenter data. Use 
      help functions to create IsocenterData. 
      Example: IsocenterData = beam_set.GetIsocenterData(Name="Iso 
      1") or IsocenterData = 
      beam_set.CreateDefaultIsocenterData(Position={'x':1, 'y':2, 
      'z':3} )
    Name - Beam name, must be unique.
    Description - Description.
    GantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CouchAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CollimatorAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.

DeleteBeam.description:
DeleteBeam(..)
  Deletes a beam from the beam list.
  Parameters:
    BeamName - The name of the beam that shall be deleted.

ComputePerturbedDose.description:
ComputePerturbedDose(..)
  Compute perturbed dose on a beam set.
  Parameters:
    DensityPerturbation - A value of the density perturbation 
      in the present fraction. Must be in the interval -0.5 to 0.5.
      Default value is 0.0.
    IsocenterShift - The shift of the isocenter in the present 
      fraction in the DICOM coordinate system.
      Default value is { 'x': 0.0, 'y': 0.0, 'z': 0.0 }.
    OnlyOneDosePerImageSet - Indicates if only one evaluation 
      dose per image set shall be allowed. 
      Previously computed evaluation doses on the selected 
      examinations will be deleted if this is set to true.
      Default is false.
    AllowGridExpansion - Indicates if expansion of the dose 
      grid is allowed if necessary. Default is true.
    ExaminationNames - The names of the examinations to be 
      used. This is a required property and the number of items
      in this list must equal the number of items in the 
      FractionNumbers property.
    FractionNumbers - The numbers of the fractions for which 
      the dose is to be computed. This is a required property
      and the number of items in this list must equal the number of 
      items in the ExaminationNames property. 
      This property must contain at least one item.
    ComputeBeamDoses - Indicates if beam doses shall be 
      computed. Default is true.

ClearBeams.description:
ClearBeams(..)
  Removes all beams or clear the contents of all beams of a beam 
  set.
  Parameters:
    RemoveBeams - Set to true if all beams should be removed.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
      Default is true.
    ClearBeamModifiers - Set to true if beam contents should 
      be cleared.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
      Default is false.

DeleteDoseSpecificationPoint.description:
DeleteDoseSpecificationPoint(..)
  Action that deletes a dose specification point.
  Parameters:
    Name - Name of the dose specification point to delete.

SortSpots.description:
SortSpots(..)
  Adds a spot
  Parameters:
    MaximumStepLength - The maximum step length allowed to be 
      taken [cm]. Distances above this value will get a penalty of 
      1000.
    UseFixedFirstSpot - True if fixing the first spot when 
      sorting. Default value is false.
    PreferredDirection - The direction which is preferred by 
      the sorting algorithm (X, Y, NoPreference).
    OfflinePenaltyFactor - Distances leaving the 
      PreferredScanDirection are multiplied by the 
      OfflinePenaltyFactor. A factor of 1 gives no penalty.

SetStandardBeamColorVisualization.description:
SetStandardBeamColorVisualization()

SetDoseValues(..)
  Sets an array of dose data to a dose distribution. The length of 
  the array must match the number of voxels in the dose grid. The 
  elements are 
  iterated in X first, then Y and Z. If the dose is a fraction dose 
  from a BeamSet that belongs to a plan then the total dose of the 
  plan is automatically updated.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    Array - 1-dimensional flattened array.
    CalculationInfo - Text information of the dose calculation.

GetDoseAtRelativeVolumes(..)

SetWeightedDose.description:
SetWeightedDose(..)
  Sets the dose to a weighted sum of the 
  fraction doses of the beam sets for a number of plans.
  If the dose distribution is a fraction dose, the plan dose is 
  updated accordingly.
  An exception is thrown if the dose distribution is a composite 
  dose, if the PlanNames array 
  is longer than the Weights array, if the PlanNames array contains 
  a name that does not 
  match any plan name for the current patient, if any of the plans 
  in the PlanNames array 
  contains no beam set or more than one beam set or if any of the 
  plans in the PlanNames array 
  does not have a computed fraction dose.
  Parameters:
    PlanNames - A list of the names of the plans whose 
      fraction doses will be used for the dose sum.
    Weights - A list of the weights of the fraction doses.

GetTransformedAndResampledDoseValues.description:
GetTransformedAndResampledDoseValues(..)
  Resamples the dose distribution to the given dose grid.
  Parameters:
    DoseGrid - The dose grid on which the dose shall be 
      resampled.
  Returns:
    An array containing the resampled dose values.

GetCenterOfRoi.description:
GetCenterOfRoi()

GetRoiVolume.description:
GetRoiVolume()

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage(..)
  Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
  It is possible to select to get the region out in a format (image 
  size, voxel size) corresponding the examination it is defined on.
  As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
  where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
              
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing should be 
  given in mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    AsExamination - If true, the number of voxels, voxel size 
      and image corner will be the same as the examination the 
      roigeometry is defined on

GetBoundingBox.description:
GetBoundingBox()
  Gets the bounding box of the ROI geometry.
  Returns:
    The bounding box of the ROI geometry as an array of points 
    corresponding to min corner and max corner (in DICOM coordinates).

SetRepresentation.description:
SetRepresentation(..)
  Primary shape of the roi geometry will (if necessary) be changed 
  to the selected representation. Representation can be:
  - Contours
  - Voxels
  - Triangle mesh
  When changing the primary shape, a conversion between shapes is 
  done which can cause a small loss of data. 
  For more information on the conversion algorithms used and its 
  implications, please see RayStation Reference Manual chapter 
  Volume handling.
              
  Remark that a geometry cannot be converted to a MBS mesh using 
  this method. This can be done from the UI using the Create MBS 
  ROI(s) functionality, selecting "ROI based on contour ROI geometry"
  Parameters:
    Representation - Name of the Representation

DeleteGeometry.description:
DeleteGeometry()
  Deletes the geometry of a RoiGeometry.

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifie.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifiedGridSettings(..)
   Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
   Dimensions are given by parameters VoxelSize, Corner and 
  NumberOfVoxels. 
   Note that the grid settings need to be such that the bounding box 
  of the geometry is covered.
              
   As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
   where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
   
   Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing is given in 
  mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    VoxelSize - Voxel size in the exported image
    Corner - Corner for the exported image
    NumberOfVoxels - Number of voxels in the exported image

HasContours.description:
HasContours()
  Returns true if PrimaryShape has contours.
  Returns:
    True or False depending on if RoiGeometry.PrimaryShape 
    contains contours.

GetDependentRois.description:
GetDependentRois()
  Gets the name of all ROIs included in the derived ROI expression.
  Returns:
    List with ROI names

SetMarginExpression.description:
SetMarginExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI expression representing a margin 
  (expansion/contraction). Should be followed by 
  UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the geometry for a 
  specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

GrayLevelThreshold.description:
GrayLevelThreshold(..)
  Gray level thresholding.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    LowThreshold - The low threshold. The unit is in rescaled 
      pixel values, e.g. HU for CT. For PET images, PetUnit must be 
      specified.
    HighThreshold - The high threshold. The unit is in 
      rescaled pixel values, e.g., HU for CT. For PET images, 
      PetUnit must be specified.
    PetUnit - The unit for PET images. Common values:
      * Bq/ml (activity concentration)
      * g/ml (SUV)
    BoundingBox - The bounding box. If specified, only pixels 
      located inside the bounding box are thresholded, pixels 
      outside are ignored. If not specified the whole image set is 
      thresholded. The bounding box is defined by the minimum and 
      maximum corners, MinCorner and MaxCorner.
      Example:
         To consider the bounding box defined by the points (x_min, 
      y_min, z_min) and (x_max, y_max, z_max), set 
      BoundingBox={"MinCorner":{'x':x_min, 'y':y_min, 'z':z_min}, 
      'MaxCorner':{'x':x_max, 'y':y_max, 'z':z_max}}

CreateCylinderGeometry.description:
CreateCylinderGeometry(..)
  Create a cylinder geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the cylinder geometry.
    Axis - The axis (cm) of the cylinder geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Length - The length (cm) of the cylinder geometry along 
      Axis.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

AdaptMbsMesh.description:
AdaptMbsMesh(..)
  Adapts an MBS mesh to the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    CustomStatistics - Custom graylevel statistics.
    CustomSettings - Custom MBS settings.

SetAsExternal.description:
SetAsExternal()
  Sets this region of interest as the external ROI. If an external 
  ROI already exists, it will be replaced by this one.

CreateExternalGeometries.description:
CreateExternalGeometries(..)
  Creates external geometries for the ROI on the specified 
  examinations.
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExamination - The reference examination.
    AdditionalExaminationNames - The additional examination 
      names.
    ReferenceThresholdLevel - The threshold level that 
      determines the outline. Set to None in order to automatically 
      calculate threshold value.
      This threshold level is used for all additional examinations 
      of same modality.

CreateMarginGeometry.description:
CreateMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a margin geometry (expansion/contraction).
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    MarginSettings - The margin settings. Defines type (Expand 
      or Contract) and distances. All distances must be positive and 
      less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

CreateControllingRoiGeometry.description:
CreateControllingRoiGeometry(..)
  Creates controlling ROI geometry for a ROI geometry on a target 
  examination using a controlling ROI geometry on a reference 
  examination
  Parameters:
    ReferenceExaminationName - The name of the examination on 
      which the controlling ROI has a geometry defined.
    TargetExaminationNames - The names of the examinations on 
      which to create a controlling ROI geometry.
    RoiGeometryName - The name of the ROI geometry which the 
      controlling ROI should adapt to.
    SmoothingRadius - Applies a morphological close and open 
      with a structuring element of the given radius 
      (in cm) before creating / adapting the triangle mesh. If set 
      to 0, no smoothing will be done.

SetRoiMaterial.description:
SetRoiMaterial(..)
  Assigns a new material to this ROI. The material density will 
  override the ROI density for dose computation on all image sets.
  Parameters:
    Material - The new material.

TransformROI3D.description:
TransformROI3D(..)
  Performs a 3D transformation of the ROI
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is 
      transformed
    TransformationMatrix - The transformation matrix
      Example:
        Move the geometry 1 cm in every direction
        TransformationMatrix = {'M11':1, 'M12':0, 'M13':0, 'M14':1,
                                'M21':0, 'M22':1, 'M23':0, 'M24':1,
                                'M31':0, 'M32':0, 'M33':1, 'M34':1,
                                'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1}
                  
      The scaling of the transformation matrix must be positive
      The last row of the transformation matrix must be the 
      following: 'M41':0, 'M42':0, 'M43':0, 'M44':1

DeleteRoi.description:
DeleteRoi()
  Action for deleting an ROI.

VolumeThreshold.description:
VolumeThreshold(..)
  Threshold ROI geometry based on volume, i.e., keep components of 
  input ROI geometry having volume in interval [MinVolume, 
  MaxVolume] cm3.
  Typically used to clean up after a gray-level thresholding or 
  region-growing operation.
  Parameters:
    InputRoi - The input ROI.
    Examination - The examination.
    MinVolume - The minimum volume (cm3).
    MaxVolume - The maximum volume (cm3).

MultiSpectralThreshold.description:
MultiSpectralThreshold(..)
  Multispectral thresholding of examinations in a MR protocol 
  group. 
  For each examination, LowThreshold and HighThreshold should be 
  given. 
  The resulting segmented region will consist of points which are in 
  the given (examination specific) range for each examination.
  RoiGeometries will be created on each examination.
  Parameters:
    ExaminationNames - The examination names. All selected 
      examinations need to be in the same MR protocol group
    LowThresholds - The low thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations
    HighThresholds - The high thresholds - one for each of the 
      selected examinations

CreateBoxGeometry.description:
CreateBoxGeometry(..)
  Create a box geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Size - The size (cm) of the box geometry in the DICOM 
      patient-based coordinate system.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

CreateExternalGeometry.description:
CreateExternalGeometry(..)
  Creates an external geometry for the ROI on the specified 
  examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    ThresholdLevel - The threshold level that determines the 
      outline. Set to None in order to automatically calculate 
      threshold value.

SetAlgebraExpression.description:
SetAlgebraExpression(..)
  Sets a derived ROI algebra expression. The expression is defined 
  with two expressions, ExpressionA and ExpressionB, and the 
  combination of these. Should be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry 
  in order to create the geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

SetWallExpression.description:
SetWallExpression(..)
  Sets a derived expression representing a wall geometry. Should 
  be followed by UpdateDerivedGeometry in order to create the 
  geometry for a specific examination.
  Parameters:
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

CreateSphereGeometry.description:
CreateSphereGeometry(..)
  Create a sphere geometry for the current ROI.
  Parameters:
    Radius - The radius (cm) of the sphere geometry.
    Examination - The examination where the geometry is created.
    Center - The center coordinate (cm) of the geometry in the 
      DICOM patient-based coordinate system.
    VoxelSize - The desired uniform voxel size (cm). Must be 
      between 0.01 and 1.0 cm. The default value is None which means 
      that a size dependent default voxel size is used. 
      Note that a explicitly setting a small voxel size for large 
      objects may lead to performance problems due to memory 
      limitations.

UpdateDerivedGeometry.description:
UpdateDerivedGeometry(..)
  Updates the derived geometry for the specified examination.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".

CreateFieldOfViewROI.description:
CreateFieldOfViewROI(..)
  Creates field-of-view ROI on a CBCT or CT image
  Parameters:
    ExaminationName - The name of the examination on which a 
      field-of-view ROI geometry will be created.

DeleteExpression.description:
DeleteExpression()
  Deletes the derived ROI expression.

CreateITV.description:
CreateITV(..)
  Creates an ITV ROI from the geometries of a source ROI in 
  several examinations. 
  The ITV geometry is the union of the geometries in the source ROI, 
  with margins applied as a final step.
  Parameters:
    SourceRegionOfInterest - The source ROI, which must have 
      geometry in all provided examinations.
    ExaminationNames - List of examinations by name. These 
      examinations must be in the same 4D examination group.
    MarginSettingsData - Margins applied to the union of the 
      geometries of the source ROI in the provided examinations.

CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry.description:
CreateDirectionalMarginGeometry(..)
  Creates a beam specific margin ROI geometry by expansion in 
  distal, proximal and lateral directions relative either to the 
  chosen beam or to the chosen manual direction.
  - Note that there is no dependency between the resulting margin 
  ROI geometry and the source ROI geometry or the selected beam.
    If any of those are changed, the margin ROI geometry becomes 
  obsolete and must be regenerated.
  - Note that the margin distances are geometrical, not radiological.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source ROI.
    Beam - A beam defining the direction. Must be defined if 
      Direction is undefined.
    Direction - The direction in DICOM patient coordinates. 
      Must be defined if Beam is undefined.
    DistalDistance - The distal distance in cm.
    ProximalDistance - The proximal distance in cm.
    LateralDistance - The lateral distance in cm.

CreateAlgebraGeometry.description:
CreateAlgebraGeometry(..)
  Creates an algebra geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    Algorithm - Defines if the logical set operations use 
      contour or voxel based methods. 
      Margins (expand/contract) and Wall operations are always 
      performed using voxel based methods.
                  
      Possible values:
      * Auto: Automatically select algorithm mode.
      * Contours: Use contour based methods.
      * Voxels: Use voxel based methods.
      Default value is "Auto".
    ExpressionA - Expression A. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionA = { 'Operation': "Union", 'SourceRoiNames': 
      ["Roi A", "Roi B"], 'MarginSettings': { 'Type': "Expand", 
      'Superior': 1, 'Inferior': 1, 'Anterior': 1, 'Posterior': 1, 
      'Right': 1, 'Left': 1 } }
    ExpressionB - Expression B. Operation must be Union or 
      Intersection.
      Example: 
        ExpressionB = { 'Operation': "Intersection", 
      'SourceRoiNames': ["Bladder", "Prostate"], 'MarginSettings': { 
      'Type': "Contract", 'Superior': 0, 'Inferior': 0, 'Anterior': 
      0, 'Posterior': 0, 'Right': 1, 'Left': 0 } }
    ResultOperation - The final operation to apply between 
      ExpressionA and ExpressionB. If it is None, Expression B is 
      not used.
      Values:
        * None
        * Union
        * Intersection
        * Subtraction
    ResultMarginSettings - The margin settings to apply to the 
      result. Defines type (Expand or Contract) and distances. All 
      distances must be positive and less than 15 cm.
      Example: MarginSettings = { 'Type': "Contract", 'Superior' : 
      0.0, 'Inferior': 1.0, 'Anterior': 1.0, 'Posterior': 0.1, 
      'Right': 0.0, 'Left': 2.3 }

CreateWallGeometry.description:
CreateWallGeometry(..)
  Creates a wall geometry.
  Parameters:
    Examination - The examination.
    SourceRoiName - The name of the source region of interest.
    OutwardDistance - The outward distance, must be positive 
      and less than 5 cm.
    InwardDistance - The inward distance, must be positive and 
      less than 5 cm.

InterpolateDoseInPoint(..)

    The interpolated point dose.

GetCenterOfRoi()

GetRoiVolume()

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImage(..)
  Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
  It is possible to select to get the region out in a format (image 
  size, voxel size) corresponding the examination it is defined on.
  As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
  where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
              
  Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing should be 
  given in mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    AsExamination - If true, the number of voxels, voxel size 
      and image corner will be the same as the examination the 
      roigeometry is defined on

GetBoundingBox.description:
GetBoundingBox()
  Gets the bounding box of the ROI geometry.
  Returns:
    The bounding box of the ROI geometry as an array of points 
    corresponding to min corner and max corner (in DICOM coordinates).

SetRepresentation.description:
SetRepresentation(..)
  Primary shape of the roi geometry will (if necessary) be changed 
  to the selected representation. Representation can be:
  - Contours
  - Voxels
  - Triangle mesh
  When changing the primary shape, a conversion between shapes is 
  done which can cause a small loss of data. 
  For more information on the conversion algorithms used and its 
  implications, please see RayStation Reference Manual chapter 
  Volume handling.
              
  Remark that a geometry cannot be converted to a MBS mesh using 
  this method. This can be done from the UI using the Create MBS 
  ROI(s) functionality, selecting "ROI based on contour ROI geometry"
  Parameters:
    Representation - Name of the Representation

DeleteGeometry.description:
DeleteGeometry()
  Deletes the geometry of a RoiGeometry.

ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifie.description:
ExportRoiGeometryAsMetaImageWithSpecifiedGridSettings(..)
   Export a roi geometry (using its voxel representation) as meta 
  image file (http://www.itk.org/Wiki/ITK/MetaIO/Documentation).
   Dimensions are given by parameters VoxelSize, Corner and 
  NumberOfVoxels. 
   Note that the grid settings need to be such that the bounding box 
  of the geometry is covered.
              
   As the voxel representation is used voxels in the exported image 
  will have values between 0 and 255, 
   where 0 correspond to voxels outside the roi geometry, 255 to 
  voxels completely inside the roi geometry, and 1 - 254 to voxels 
  on the boundary of the roi geometry, describing the relative 
  belongingness to the roi geometry.
   
   Note that meta image file uses mm as unit. Hence 
  Offset/Position/Origin and ElementSize/ElementSpacing is given in 
  mm.
  Parameters:
    MetaFileName - File name
    VoxelSize - Voxel size in the exported image
    Corner - Corner for the exported image
    NumberOfVoxels - Number of voxels in the exported image

SetWeightedDose.description:
SetWeightedDose(..)
  Sets the dose to a weighted sum of the 
  fraction doses of the beam sets for a number of plans.
  If the dose distribution is a fraction dose, the plan dose is 
  updated accordingly.
  An exception is thrown if the dose distribution is a composite 
  dose, if the PlanNames array 
  is longer than the Weights array, if the PlanNames array contains 
  a name that does not 
  match any plan name for the current patient, if any of the plans 
  in the PlanNames array 
  contains no beam set or more than one beam set or if any of the 
  plans in the PlanNames array 
  does not have a computed fraction dose.
  Parameters:
    PlanNames - A list of the names of the plans whose 
      fraction doses will be used for the dose sum.
    Weights - A list of the weights of the fraction doses.

GetTransformedAndResampledDoseValues.description:
GetTransformedAndResampledDoseValues(..)
  Resamples the dose distribution to the given dose grid.
  Parameters:
    DoseGrid - The dose grid on which the dose shall be 
      resampled.
  Returns:
    An array containing the resampled dose values.

MergeAutoBreastBeams.description:
MergeAutoBreastBeams()
  Merge beams (A1 += A1_OPT, A2 += A2_OPT).
  Calculate CC dose.

CreateArcBeam.description:
CreateArcBeam(..)
  Creates and adds a beam of VMAT type.
  Parameters:
    ArcStopGantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    ArcRotationDirection - Rotation direction of the gantry.
      * Clockwise
      * CounterClockwise
    Energy - Energy for this beam (MV).
    IsocenterData - Dictionary containing isocenter data. Use 
      help functions to create IsocenterData. 
      Example: IsocenterData = beam_set.GetIsocenterData(Name="Iso 
      1") or IsocenterData = 
      beam_set.CreateDefaultIsocenterData(Position={'x':1, 'y':2, 
      'z':3} )
    Name - Beam name, must be unique.
    Description - Description.
    GantryAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CouchAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.
    CollimatorAngle - Angle unit and direction follow IEC.

DeleteBeam.description:
DeleteBeam(..)
  Deletes a beam from the beam list.
  Parameters:
    BeamName - The name of the beam that shall be deleted.

ComputePerturbedDose.description:
ComputePerturbedDose(..)
  Compute perturbed dose on a beam set.
  Parameters:
    DensityPerturbation - A value of the density perturbation 
      in the present fraction. Must be in the interval -0.5 to 0.5.
      Default value is 0.0.
    IsocenterShift - The shift of the isocenter in the present 
      fraction in the DICOM coordinate system.
      Default value is { 'x': 0.0, 'y': 0.0, 'z': 0.0 }.
    OnlyOneDosePerImageSet - Indicates if only one evaluation 
      dose per image set shall be allowed. 
      Previously computed evaluation doses on the selected 
      examinations will be deleted if this is set to true.
      Default is false.
    AllowGridExpansion - Indicates if expansion of the dose 
      grid is allowed if necessary. Default is true.
    ExaminationNames - The names of the examinations to be 
      used. This is a required property and the number of items
      in this list must equal the number of items in the 
      FractionNumbers property.
    FractionNumbers - The numbers of the fractions for which 
      the dose is to be computed. This is a required property
      and the number of items in this list must equal the number of 
      items in the ExaminationNames property. 
      This property must contain at least one item.
    ComputeBeamDoses - Indicates if beam doses shall be 
      computed. Default is true.

ClearBeams.description:
ClearBeams(..)
  Removes all beams or clear the contents of all beams of a beam 
  set.
  Parameters:
    RemoveBeams - Set to true if all beams should be removed.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
      Default is true.
    ClearBeamModifiers - Set to true if beam contents should 
      be cleared.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
      Default is false.

DeleteDoseSpecificationPoint.description:
DeleteDoseSpecificationPoint(..)
  Action that deletes a dose specification point.
  Parameters:
    Name - Name of the dose specification point to delete.

SortSpots.description:
SortSpots(..)
  Adds a spot
  Parameters:
    MaximumStepLength - The maximum step length allowed to be 
      taken [cm]. Distances above this value will get a penalty of 
      1000.
    UseFixedFirstSpot - True if fixing the first spot when 
      sorting. Default value is false.
    PreferredDirection - The direction which is preferred by 
      the sorting algorithm (X, Y, NoPreference).
    OfflinePenaltyFactor - Distances leaving the 
      PreferredScanDirection are multiplied by the 
      OfflinePenaltyFactor. A factor of 1 gives no penalty.

SetStandardBeamColorVisualization()

DeleteEvaluationDose.description:
DeleteEvaluationDose()
  Deletes the dose distribution if it is an evaluation dose.
  An exception is thrown if the dose distribution is not an 
  evaluation dose or 
  if the dose distribution is marked as imported.

InterpolateDoseInPoints.description:
InterpolateDoseInPoints(..)

  Parameters:

      the dose is interpolated. The point's coordinates are given in 
      the DICOM coordinate system.
  Returns:
    An array of interpolated point doses.

SetDoseValues.description:
SetDoseValues(..)
  Sets an array of dose data to a dose distribution. The length of 
  the array must match the number of voxels in the dose grid. The 
  elements are 
  iterated in X first, then Y and Z. If the dose is a fraction dose 
  from a BeamSet that belongs to a plan then the total dose of the 
  plan is automatically updated.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    Array - 1-dimensional flattened array.
    CalculationInfo - Text information of the dose calculation.

EvaluateClinicalGoal()
  Method for evaluation of a clinical goal function.
  Returns:
    Returns true if the clinical goal is fulfilled and false

EditOptimizationFunction.description:
EditOptimizationFunction(..)
  Edits an objective constituent or a constraint.
  Parameters:
    FunctionType - The function type.
      * MinDose
      * MaxDose
      * MinDvh 
      * MaxDvh
      * UniformDose 
      * MinEud 
      * MaxEud
      * TargetEud
      * DoseFallOff
      * UniformityConstraint
    DoseBasedRoiFunction - The objective constituent or a 
      constraint that should be edited.
    RoiName - Name of the function dependent ROI.
    IsConstraint - Whether the function is to be a constraint 
      or an objective.
    RestrictAllBeamsIndividually - If the restriction is to be 
      applied to all beams individually. Only used for Protons or 
      physical Carbon dose.
    RestrictToBeam - Name of the beam when restricting dose 
      dependencies to a single beam.
      Null means no restriction. Only used for Protons or physical 
      Carbon dose.
    IsRobust - Whether the worst-case robustness should be 
      used (requieres parameters in robustness settings).
    RestrictToBeamSet - Whether the function should refer to 
      total dose or beam set dose.
    UseRbeDose - True if the function should target RBE dose; 
      false if it should target physical dose.
      Not used for modalities not using RBE dose (i.e. Photons, 
      Electrons and Protons).

SaveRobustnessParameters.description:
SaveRobustnessParameters(..)
  Saves robustness parameters.
  Parameters:
    PositionUncertaintyAnterior - The 
      PositionUncertaintyAnterior that shall be copied.
    PositionUncertaintyPosterior - The 
      PositionUncertaintyPosterior that shall be copied.
    PositionUncertaintySuperior - The 
      PositionUncertaintySuperior that shall be copied.
    PositionUncertaintyInferior - The 
      PositionUncertaintyInferior that shall be copied.
    PositionUncertaintyLeft - The PositionUncertaintyLeft that 
      shall be copied.
    PositionUncertaintyRight - The PositionUncertaintyRight 
      that shall be copied.
    DensityUncertainty - The DensityUncertainty that shall be 
      copied.
    IndependentBeams - The IndependentBeams that shall be 
      copied.
    ComputeExactScenarioDoses - The ComputeExactScenarioDoses 
      that shall be copied.
    NamesOfNonPlanningExaminations - Examinations that shall 
      be considered, disregarding the planning examination.

EditArcBasedBeamOptimizationSettings.description:
EditArcBasedBeamOptimizationSettings(..)
  Edit the arc based beam optimization settings for selected beam
  Parameters:
    ConformalArcStyle - If true the VMAT beam is converted 
      using conformal style based on target projections from all 
      directions.
    CreateDualArcs - True if dual arcs shall be used.
    FinalGantrySpacing - The distance between the gantry 
      angles of two neighboring segments (control points) [deg].
    MaxArcDeliveryTime - The maximum delivery time for the arc 
      beam [s].
    BurstGantrySpacing - The gantry distance for which the 
      beam is on using a machine in burst mode (Beam on interval).
      Otherwise for a machine NOT in burst mode; not applicable (set 
      this property to null to indicate that)
      [deg].
    MaxArcMU - The maximum total MU for the arc beam.

EditBeamOptimizationSettings.description:
EditBeamOptimizationSettings(..)
  Edits the beam optimization settings for selected beam
  Parameters:
    OptimizationTypes - Enumerator describing how a beam may 
      be optimized.
      That is, in which manner the optimization should be performed.
      The enumerator array is a combination of different allowed 
      optimizations.
    SelectCollimatorAngle - If true, select collimator angle 
      at sequencing.
    AllowBeamSplit - Indicates if a beam split should be 
      attempted when the field is to wide for current machine 
      contraints.
    JawMotion - Can be any of the following strings:
      "Fixed"
      "Automatic"
      "Lock to limits"
      "Use limits as max"
    LeftJaw - Left jaw [X1].
    RightJaw - Right jaw [X2].
    TopJaw - Top jaw [Y1].
    BottomJaw - Bottom jaw [Y2].

AddReferenceOptimizationFunction.description:
AddReferenceOptimizationFunction(..)
  Creates and adds a reference optimization function
  Parameters:
    FunctionType - The function type.
      * MaxRefDose
      * MaxRefDvh
      * MinRefDose
      * MinRefDvh
      * RefDoseFallOff
    ReferenceDoseDistribution - The reference dose distribution.
    RoiName - Name of the function dependent ROI.
    IsConstraint - Whether the function is to be a constraint 
      or an objective.
    RestrictAllBeamsIndividually - If the restriction is to be 
      applied to all beams individually. Only used for Protons or 
      physical Carbon dose.
    RestrictToBeam - Name of the beam when restricting dose 
      dependencies to a single beam.
      Null means no restriction. Only used for Protons or physical 
      Carbon dose.
    IsRobust - Whether the worst-case robustness should be 
      used (requieres parameters in robustness settings).
    RestrictToBeamSet - Whether the function should refer to 
      total dose or beam set dose.
    UseRbeDose - True if the function should target RBE dose; 
      false if it should target physical dose.
      Not used for modalities not using RBE dose (i.e. Photons, 
      Electrons and Protons).

AddMcoCreateDeliverablePlanFunctions()

ApplyClinicalGoalTemplate.description:
ApplyClinicalGoalTemplate(..)
  Copies clinical goals from a template.
  Parameters:
    Template - The template that contains the functions. 
      Functions corresponding to ROIs/POIs

AddClinicalGoal.description:
AddClinicalGoal(..)
  Adds a clinical goal to an evaluation setup
  Parameters:
    RoiName - The name of the ROI or POI the planning goal 
      shall be evaluated on.
    GoalCriteria - The planning goal criteria. Specifies the 
      region for pass and fail.
      * AtLeast: At least criteria.
      * AtMost: At most criteria.
    GoalType - The planning goal type. 
      * AverageDose: For comparison with the average dose.
      * VolumeAtDose: For comparison of the volume at a specified 
      dose.
      * DoseAtVolume: For comparison of the dose at a specified 
      volume.
      * DoseAtPoint: For comparison with the dose at a certain point.
      * AbsoluteVolumeAtDose: For comparison of the absolute volume 
      at a specified dose.
      * DoseAtAbsoluteVolume: For comparison of the dose at a 
      specified absolute volume.
    AcceptanceLevel - The acceptance level. Sets the level for 
      pass or fail.
    ParameterValue - The parameter value. Goal type specific 
      parameter.
    IsComparativeGoal - Determines if the goal is used as a 
      comparative goal.
    Priority - The priority of the clinical goal.

DeleteClinicalGoal.description:
DeleteClinicalGoal(..)
  Deletes a clinical goal.
  Parameters:
    FunctionToRemove - The clinical goal that shall be removed.

ComputeDeliveryDoseWithDeformation.description:
ComputeDeliveryDoseWithDeformation(..)
  Action used to compute delivery dose and do optional deformation 
  of that dose
  Parameters:
    FractionNumbers - The numbers of the fractions for which 
      the dose is to be computed. This is a required property
      and the number of items in this list must equal the number of 
      items in the ExaminationNames and
      StructureRegistrationNames properties. This property must 
      contain at least one item.
    ExaminationNames - The names of the examinations to be 
      used. This is a required property and the number of items
      in this list must equal the number of items in the 
      FractionNumbers and StructureRegistrationNames
      properties.
    StructureRegistrationNames - The names of the provided 
      structure registrations. If an item in the list is empty, the 
      dose will
      not be deformed. The number of items in this list must equal 
      the number of items in the
      FractionNumbers and ExaminationNames properties.

UpdateDoseGridStructures.description:
UpdateDoseGridStructures()
  Computes uncomputed RoiVolumeDistributions. If the current 
  DoseGridStructures of the DoseDistribution contains DoseGridRois 
  computed with an old algoritm version, the DoseGridStructures will 
  be replaced with a new version.

GetDoseStatistic.description:
GetDoseStatistic(..)
  Method for retrieving dose statistics
  Parameters:
    RoiName - The name of the ROI.
    DoseType - The dose statistic type, "Average", "Min" or 
      "Max".
  Returns:
    The dose statistic.

DeleteEvaluationDose.description:
DeleteEvaluationDose()
  Deletes the dose distribution if it is an evaluation dose.
  An exception is thrown if the dose distribution is not an 
  evaluation dose or 
  if the dose distribution is marked as imported.

InterpolateDoseInPoints.description:
InterpolateDoseInPoints(..)
  Returns an array of interpolated dose values in the given array 
  of points.
  Parameters:
    Points - The list of coordinates of the points in which 
      the dose is interpolated. The point's coordinates are given in 
      the DICOM coordinate system.
  Returns:
    An array of interpolated point doses.

SetDoseValues.description:
SetDoseValues(..)
  Sets an array of dose data to a dose distribution. The length of 
  the array must match the number of voxels in the dose grid. The 
  elements are 
  iterated in X first, then Y and Z. If the dose is a fraction dose 
  from a BeamSet that belongs to a plan then the total dose of the 
  plan is automatically updated.
  This method is for experimental use - use with care.
  Parameters:
    Array - 1-dimensional flattened array.
    CalculationInfo - Text information of the dose calculation.

GetDoseAtRelativeVolumes.description:
GetDoseAtRelativeVolumes(..)
  Method for retrieving DVH points.
  Parameters:
    RoiName - The name of the ROI.
    RelativeVolumes - The relative volumes.
  Returns:
    The dose at the relative volumes.

GetDoseGridRoi.description:
GetDoseGridRoi(..)
  Gets the dose grid representation of a specific ROI for the dose 
  grid of the dose distribution.
  Parameters:
    RoiName - The name of the ROI.
  Returns:
    The dose grid representation of the ROI.

SetWeightedDose.description:
SetWeightedDose(..)
  Sets the dose to a weighted sum of the 
  fraction doses of the beam sets for a number of plans.
  If the dose distribution is a fraction dose, the plan dose is 
  updated accordingly.
  An exception is thrown if the dose distribution is a composite 
  dose, if the PlanNames array 
  is longer than the Weights array, if the PlanNames array contains 
  a name that does not 
  match any plan name for the current patient, if any of the plans 
  in the PlanNames array 
  contains no beam set or more than one beam set or if any of the 
  plans in the PlanNames array 
  does not have a computed fraction dose.
  Parameters:
    PlanNames - A list of the names of the plans whose 
      fraction doses will be used for the dose sum.
    Weights - A list of the weights of the fraction doses.

GetTransformedAndResampledDoseValues.description:
GetTransformedAndResampledDoseValues(..)
  Resamples the dose distribution to the given dose grid.
  Parameters:
    DoseGrid - The dose grid on which the dose shall be 
      resampled.
  Returns:
    An array containing the resampled dose values.

InterpolateDoseInPoint.description:

GetRelativeVolumeAtDoseValues(..)

RunReduceOARDoseOptimization.description:
RunReduceOARDoseOptimization(..)
  Runs a reduce organ-at-risk optimization.
  Auto-generated reference dose functions are used to reduce the 
  dose in 
  the organs-at-risk regions while maintaining dose homogeneity in 
  the target regions.
  Parameters:
    UseVoxelBasedMimickingForTargets - Indicates if voxel 
      based mimicking constraints should be used for target ROIs.
      If false, DVH based mimicking constraints is used for target 
      ROIs.
      Default is false.
    UseVoxelBasedMimickingForOrgansAtRisk - Indicates if 
      voxel-based mimicking constraints should be used for 
      organ-at-risk ROIs.
      If false, DVH-based mimicking constraints is used for 
      organ-at-risk ROIs.
      Default is false.
    OrgansAtRiskToImprove - Names of the ROIs that should be 
      considered as objectives in the optimization problem.
      Must be a subset of OrgansAtRiskToMaintain.
      Default is ROIs defined in OrgansAtRiskToMaintain.
    TargetsToMaintain - Names of the ROIs that should be 
      considered as target ROIs in the optimization problem.
      The optimization uses mimicking constraints to maintain the 
      uniformity of the dose for these ROIs.
      Must be disjoint with OrgansAtRiskToMaintain.
      Default is all ROIs with target optimization functions in the 
      original optimization problem.
    OrgansAtRiskToMaintain - Names of the ROIs that should be 
      considered as organs-at-risk in the optimization problem.
      The optimization uses mimicking constraints to avoid 
      increasing the dose for these ROIs.
      Must be disjoint with TargetsToMaintain.
      Default is all ROIs without target optimization functions in 
      the original optimization problem.

ApplyOptimizationTemplate.description:
ApplyOptimizationTemplate(..)
  Copies optimization functions from a template.
  Parameters:
    Template - The template that contains the functions. 
      Functions corresponding to ROIs/POIs
      that are not contained in the patient model will not be added.

EditResearchOptimizationFunction.description:
EditResearchOptimizationFunction(..)
  Edits a research objective constituent.
  Parameters:
    Function - The objective constituent that should be edited.
    RoiName - Name of the function dependent ROI.
    Parameters - String holding the parameters of the research 
      function.
      The first word must be the name of the research function.
    Weight - The weight of the objective function.
      Not used if the function is a constraint.
    IsConstraint - True if the function is a constraint, false 
      otherwise.
    RestrictAllBeamsIndividually - Restricts the function to 
      all beams individually. Default is false.
    RestrictToBeam - Restricts the function to the beam with 
      the given name.
      Null means no restriction. Default is null.
    RestrictToBeamSet - Restricts the function to the beam set 
      with the given name.
      Null means that the function operates on the plan dose. 
      Default is null.
    UseRbeDose - True if the function should target RBE dose; 
      false if it should target physical dose.

AddResearchOptimizationFunction.description:
AddResearchOptimizationFunction(..)
  Creates and adds a research objective constituent.
  Parameters:
    CompositeParameters - String that holds parameters for a 
      composite research function.
    RoiName - Name of the function dependent ROI.
    Parameters - String holding the parameters of the research 
      function.
      The first word must be the name of the research function.
    Weight - The weight of the objective function.
      Not used if the function is a constraint.
    IsConstraint - True if the function is a constraint, false 
      otherwise.
    RestrictAllBeamsIndividually - Restricts the function to 
      all beams individually. Default is false.
    RestrictToBeam - Restricts the function to the beam with 
      the given name.
      Null means no restriction. Default is null.
    RestrictToBeamSet - Restricts the function to the beam set 
      with the given name.
      Null means that the function operates on the plan dose. 
      Default is null.
    UseRbeDose - True if the function should target RBE dose; 
      false if it should target physical dose.

AddOptimizationFunction.description:
AddOptimizationFunction(..)
  Creates and adds an objective constituent or a constraint.
  Parameters:
    FunctionType - The function type.
      * MinDose
      * MaxDose
      * MinDvh 
      * MaxDvh
      * UniformDose 
      * MinEud 
      * MaxEud
      * TargetEud
      * DoseFallOff
      * UniformityConstraint
    RoiName - Name of the function dependent ROI.
    IsConstraint - Whether the function is to be a constraint 
      or an objective.
    RestrictAllBeamsIndividually - If the restriction is to be 
      applied to all beams individually. Only used for Protons or 
      physical Carbon dose.
    RestrictToBeam - Name of the beam when restricting dose 
      dependencies to a single beam.
      Null means no restriction. Only used for Protons or physical 
      Carbon dose.
    IsRobust - Whether the worst-case robustness should be 
      used (requieres parameters in robustness settings).
    RestrictToBeamSet - Whether the function should refer to 
      total dose or beam set dose.
    UseRbeDose - True if the function should target RBE dose; 
      false if it should target physical dose.
      Not used for modalities not using RBE dose (i.e. Photons, 
      Electrons and Protons).

QueryBeamSetInfo.description:
QueryBeamSetInfo(..)
  Returns info on all beam sets on a treatment plan.
  Example:
    To return info on all beam sets with the exact name 
    'BeamSet1' in a treatment plan:
    info = treatmentPlan.QueryBeamSetInfo(Filter = {'Name': 
    '^BeamSet1$'}
  Parameters:
    Filter - Filter using regular expressions.  
                  Possible keys:
                     *Id
                     *Name
                     *ApprovalStatus
                     *IsImmutable
                     *IsClinical
                     *HasDose
                     *DoseAlgorithm
                     *AlgorithmVersion
  Returns:
    List of beam set information.

  Parameters:

    OverwriteExisting -

UpdateDependency.description:
UpdateDependency(..)
  Changes the way a beam set depends on the other beam set. When a 
  beam set is set as dependent, the other beam set dose is used as 
  background dose.
  Any prescriptions or optimization functions 
  defined on the dependent beam set will be removed.
  Parameters:
    DependentBeamSetName - The beam set that will be or is 
      dependent.
    BackgroundBeamSetName - The beam set that will be the 
      background beam set.
    DependencyUpdate - How dependency should be updated.
      * CreateDependency
      * RemoveDependency

SetBeamSetsToOptimizeSimultaneously(..)
  Sets beam sets to be optimized simultaneously
  Parameters:
    BeamSetNames - The name of the beam sets that should be 
      optimized simultaneously

AddNewAdaptedBeamSet.description:
AddNewAdaptedBeamSet(..)
  Composite action for adding
  Parameters:
    AdaptToRadiationSet - Radiation set to adapt to.
    RemoveBeams - Set to true if all beams should be removed.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
    ClearBeamModifiers - Set to true if beam contents should 
      be cleared.
      If both RemoveBeams and ClearBeamModifiers are true,
      beams will be removed. If both are false, nothing will be done.
    Name - The name of the new beam set.
    ExaminationName - The name of the examination on which the 
      beam set is defined.
    MachineName - The name on the treatment machine. The 
      latest commissioned version og this machine will be used.
    Modality - The treatment modality.
      * Photons
      * Protons
      * Carbon
      * Electrons
    TreatmentTechnique - Treatment technique.
      * Conformal                - Photons 3DCRT treatment technique.
      * SMLC                     - Photons SMLC treatment technique.
      * VMAT                     - Photons VMAT treatment technique
      * DMLC                     - Photons DMLC.
      * StaticArc                - Photons static arc.
      * TomoHelical              - Photons tomo helical.
      * ProtonPencilBeamScanning - Protons pencil beam scanning.
      * LineScanning             - Protons line scanning.
      * UniformScanning          - Protons uniform scanning.
      * Wobbling                 - Protons wobbling scanning.
      * SingleScattering         - Protons single scattering.
      * DoubleScattering         - Protons double scattering.
      * ApplicatorAndCutout      - Electrons applicator and cutout.
      * CarbonPencilBeamScanning - Carbon pencil beam scanning.
    PatientPosition - Specifies the position of the patient 
      relative to the treatment/image equipment space.
      * HeadFirstProne
      * HeadFirstSupine
      * FeetFirstProne
      * FeetFirstSupine
      * HeadFirstDecubitusLeft
      * HeadFirstDecubitusRight
      * FeetFirstDecubitusLeft
      * FeetFirstDecubitusRight
    NumberOfFractions - The number of fractions in the new 
      beam set.
    CreateSetupBeams - Whether setup beams shall be created in 
      this beam set.
    UseLocalizationPointAsSetupIsocenter - True to use 
      localization point instead of isocenter from treatment beams 
      for the setup beams
    Comment - The beam set comment
    RbeModelReference - The RBE model to use for an ion 
      radiation set; or null if no RBE model is used
    EnableDynamicTrackingForVero - Indicates if Dynamic 
      tracking for the Vero Linac is enabled or disabled

CopyPlanAndAddAsNewBeamSet.description:
CopyPlanAndAddAsNewBeamSet(..)
  Copies a plan (with one beam set) and adds it as new beam set to 
  another plan.
  The same prerequisites as when adding a new beam set to the 
  current plan, i.e.,
   - same planning image
   - same patient position
   - same dose grid size, corner and resolution
   - supported delivery technique
   - commissioned machine
              
  A deep clone of the radiation set is done. Objective functions are 
  not copied over.
  Parameters:
    PlanName - Name of the plan to copy.
    NewBeamSetName - The name of the new beam set.

LoadBeamSet.description:
LoadBeamSet(..)
  Loads a beam set from a treatment plan. Returns a handle to the 
  beam set.
  Example:
    To return a handle to the first beam set in a list retrieved 
    from QueryBeamSetInfo:
    infos = treatmentPlan.QueryBeamSetInfo( Filter = {'Name': 
    'Plan1'} )
    plan = treatmentPlan.LoadBeamSet( BeamSetInfo = infos[0] )
  Parameters:
    BeamSetInfo - Information about the plan to be selected. 
      The beam set info must match one and only one beam set.
  Returns:
    The loaded beam set.

PlanMimic.description:
PlanMimic(..)

    TargetLinacName - The name of the linac that the backup 
      plan should target.
    TargetPlanBaseName - The name of the new backup plan.
    TargetOverOARWeights - The Target-over-OAR weights to use.

SetCurrent.description:
SetCurrent()
  Sets the current plan.
  Example:
    To set a plan namned "Plan X" as the current plan.
    plan = case.TreatmentPlans["Plan X"]
    plan.SetCurrent()
  Returns:

PreparePlanForDelivery.description:
PreparePlanForDelivery(..)

UpdateDoseGrid.description:
UpdateDoseGrid(..)
  Updates the dose grid of a plan.
  Parameters:
    Corner - The dose grid corner in DICOM patient coordinates.
    VoxelSize - The voxel sizes in DICOM patient coordinate

    NumberOfVoxels - The number of voxels in DICOM patient

ImageSimilarityForRigidRegistration.description:
ImageSimilarityForRigidRegistration(..)
  Compute image similarity between two images (reference and 
  target). A rigid transformation is applied to the reference image. 
  Use Patient.GetTransformForExaminations() with FromExamination as 
  reference and ToExamination as target to 
  get the transform corresponding to the frame-of-reference 
  registration.
              
  Only voxels inside the selected rois on the reference image are 
  considered. If no rois are selected, external geometry will be used
   (i.e., consistent with rigid image registration algorithm)
  Parameters:
    ReferenceImageName - Name of the reference image. The 
      rigid transformation will be applied to this image.
    TargetImageName - Name of the target image.
    RigidTransformation - Rigid transformation as a double 
      array.
    RoiNames - Names of the rois over which you want to 
      compute image similarity. If left empty the external geometry 
      will be used
  Returns:
    A dictionary with 'CorrelationCoefficient'

CopyMultiplePlansToExploration.description:
CopyMultiplePlansToExploration(..)

  plans in a plan exploration.

      where the plans will be copied.

                     *IsApproved
